programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine

programme.title: Buffalo Bill and the Indians (1976)
programme.desc: During a winter break from his touring Wild West show, Buffalo Bill Cody takes time out to reveal how he created the myth of himself as a great adventurer. Robert Altman's Western biopic, starring Paul Newman, Joel Grey, Burt Lancaster and Harvey Keitel

programme.title: Five Guns West (1954)
programme.desc: Five convicted outlaws, all facing the gallows, are offered a last minute reprieve by the Confederacy - provided they undertake a dangerous mission. An intelligence agent has switched sides to support the North, and must be captured alive, along with the shipment of gold he's carrying. But the temptation to run off with the loot is hard to resist. Western, starring John Lund, Dorothy Malone, Touch Connors and Paul Birch

programme.title: The Lone Ranger (1956)
programme.desc: The masked hero and his faithful sidekick battle a wealthy rancher trying to stir up a war between settlers and native Americans so he can plunder the silver beneath a sacred mountain. Western, starring Clayton Moore and Jay Silverheels

programme.title: Star Trek

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine

programme.title: The Prisoner

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: Year of the Gun (1991)
programme.desc: An American journalist covering political news in Rome finds his life endangered by Red Brigade terrorists, who suspect him of investigating their activities. Unfortunately for him, they are in the middle of plotting a daring kidnapping - and will protect their plans by any means necessary. Thriller, starring Andrew McCarthy, Sharon Stone, Valeria Golino and John Pankow

programme.title: Black Rock (2012)
programme.desc: Three women try to rebuild their lost friendship by exploring a deserted island they first visited as children. They befriend three hunters, but when one of them turns violent, they kill him in self-defence. The two remaining men want revenge, leaving the women facing a battle for survival. Thriller, directed by and starring Katie Aselton. With Lake Bell and Kate Bosworth

programme.title: The Shrine (2010)
programme.desc: Journalists investigate the disappearance of a backpacker travelling across Europe, and trace his final recorded sighting to a remote village in Poland. They travel there in search of the truth, only to be attacked by hostile locals and fall into the clutches of a cult performing human sacrifices. Horror, starring Aaron Ashmore and Cindy Sampson

programme.title: Instrument Of War (2017)
programme.desc: When US B-24 bomber pilot Clair Cline is captured in northern Germany, he and his fellow PoWs must find a way to survive their captivity during the Second World War. Drama, starring Jack Ashton and Elliot James Langridge

programme.title: Circus of Horrors (1960)
programme.desc: Anton Diffring stars as a deranged plastic surgeon who offers crooks the chance to start afresh by providing them with a new appearance - on condition that they staff his run-down circus. It's not long before some of his customers decide to renege on the deal and escape his clutches - prompting him to embark on a murderous spree. Top-class chiller, a genre classic and must-see for aficionados of Sixties horror films, with Donald Pleasance giving his all as an unfortunate ringmaster, alongside Erika Remberg, Yvonne Monlaur and Jane Hylton

programme.desc: The residents are troubled by a bicycle, and Compo's lucky rabbit's foot causes even more problems, while Sid tries his best to avoid Ivy. Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Michael Bates star in the long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

With the help and advice of Dom Chinea and his team of experts, Mike and Sarah try their best to create smooth running businesses out of their crafts and turn their hobbies into a day job

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Roo Irvine and Mark Hill continue their Scottish jaunt as a 1970s Triumph transports the duo to shops scattered throughout the Highlands. A Georgian silver brooch gives veteran Tripper Roo something solemn to think about, but a rather unorthodox key rack, she hopes, will unlock some big profits. Meanwhile, rookie Tripper Mark continues to buy like an old hand as he finds a wooden sculpture of a naked torso that makes for an exhilarating auction

Then they have to make a main course and a dessert for a dinner party, knowing that John Torode and Gregg Wallace will be sending one of them home

programme.desc: Kwabena and Amy meet a white industry executive famed for successful films and TV shows with black talent. Kwabena also meets Vanessa's wealthy friends, Amy continues to struggle with microaggressions at work, and Maurice decides to go vegan. Guest starring Jessica Hynes and Isy Suttie

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Funmi goes into labour, but when the doctors refuse to listen to her concerns, she ends up forced into an emergency c-section that leaves her life hanging in the balance. A baby on the way means Kwabena desperately needs somewhere new to live, but given his financial situation, and the housing crisis in London, it's proving difficult. Stephanie is worried about her son, a cheeky, aspiring rapper who has fallen in with the wrong crowd

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the rich and diverse history of West Penwith, the farthest point west in mainland Britain. He visits Lamorna Cove, made famous through song and art, and the Unesco-protected tin and copper mining area of Botallack, where he talks to a mining explorer. The chef also follows an ancient track in search of Cornwall's oldest building and reveals how, as a young lad on the Lizard Peninsula, he fell in love for the first time and tasted his first French fish stew - known as a bouillabaisse

The duo visit Holy Island - the setting for the writer's first novel - where they join a tour guide to find out more about the religious connections with the area. The actor is then joined by his partner Zoila for a caravan stay on a cattle farm before taking to the skies in a lightweight aircraft

programme.desc: Aspiring makers are given the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses, joining Dom Chinea at a training camp in the grounds of an Arts and Crafts house in Leicestershire. Izzy has given up a career in advertising to try to become a full-time potter. Stone carver Luke needs help overcoming a serious confidence problem that is holding him back

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?

programme.title: Schindler's List (1993)
programme.desc: In German-occupied Poland during the Second World War, businessman and Nazi Party member Oskar Schindler is deeply affected when he witnesses the clearing of the Krakow Ghetto. He decides to try to save Jews destined for the concentration camps by employing them in his factory - an act of mercy made possible by a deal struck with a sadistic German commandant. Steven Spielberg's Oscar-winning drama, starring Liam Neeson, Ben Kingsley and Ralph Fiennes

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: As the chef's Cornish odyssey nears its end, he takes a break in the city of Truro, where he discovers an unusual ghost story and tours the magnificent cathedral. He also meets a family passionate about offal, who prepare Rick a meal of pickled ox tongue and beef heart tacos, and in the county's most northerly parish he tells the story of an eccentric vicar who would retrieve the bodies from nearby shipwrecks and bury them in his church graveyard

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor is joined by Hairy Biker Si King on his quest to find new ways of spending time in the great outdoors. Taking the scenic route north to Chillingham, the pair head out to visit the estate's famous wild cattle

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a family with two children to find a home in Devon with a large garden, and discovers an approach to woodcraft that uses steam to sculpt interior design pieces

For artistically inclined Gemma, it's all about proving her careers advisor wrong. Dom Chinea presents

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Snowdon, or Yr Wyddfa, is the most popular mountain in Britain, attracting three-quarters of a million visitors each year - and it only getting busier. This documentary follows the work that goes in to keeping the tourists happy, including the maintenance of the five-mile mountain railway, which not only carries visitors but also supplies to the shop and cafe and even water and waste to and from the toilets. Meanwhile, wardens patrol the mountain to ensure the safety of walkers, and volunteers spends their weekends collecting tons of discarded rubbish

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: British athletics great Roger Black, former Premier League midfielder Steve Sidwell, Paralympian-turned-broadcaster Ade Adepitan and Olympic gold medal-winning hockey player Alex Danson-Bennett join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining celebrities take part in their final challenge, for which they cook a two-course meal that will be judged not only by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also Celebrity MasterChef Champions Angellica Bell (2017) and Lisa Snowdon (2022) and 2022 finalist Danny Jones. The best will go through to the semi-final. The others will be hanging up their MasterChef aprons

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee goes to watch Benji playing football for a local under-13 team and is unable to restrain himself on the touchline and becomes the competitive dad that all other parents want to avoid. Undaunted by the disapproval of Toby, who coaches the team, Lee sets about rigging the vote for the player of the year. With a guest appearance from veteran actor Melvyn Hayes

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: The morning after the night before has not started well. Diane is worried that she did not impress the school governors, Kath is revealing more than she should to the women in the old people's home and Martin is desperately trying to get his hands on a chunk of cash

Steven Spielberg's fantasy adventure based on Ernest Cline's novel, starring Tye Sheridan, Olivia Cooke, Ben Mendelsohn, Simon Pegg and Mark Rylance

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Nick Ansell heads to the National Space Centre where astronomy enthusiast Derek Rowley talks about a project that's making the subject of space more accessible to deaf people. The programme also follows deaf mountaineer Morag Skelton as she climbs Scimitar Ridge in Glen Nevis, and Tyron Wolfe, who spent eight months journeying around South America, shares tips on travelling alone

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey in the East Yorkshire resort of Hornsea, famous for its distinctive pottery. In Hull, he discovers how one of Hull FC's star players made history as Britain's first black rugby captain. From Hull, Michael hitches a ride on a fine-looking barge heading to Goole on a network of canals. At Spurn Point, Michael hears how along this coast an ingenious 19th-century RNLI invention saved many lives

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: South Africa v Italy (Kick-off 8.00am). All the action from the third and final Group G match for both teams, held at Wellington Regional Stadium in New Zealand

programme.title: Impossible

programme.desc: Four more contenders take to the black chair under the spotlight and the ticking clock to answer questions on their specialist subjects and general knowledge. John Humphrys asks the questions, which are on The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin, Marlene Dumas, the life and poetry of Edward Thomas and Guy Burgess

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Artists create pieces for buyers in Chesterfield who want something special to remember their beloved fathers and a stepdad, who they lost within the space of two years

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Denis and Eric from Herefordshire have spent almost 40 years rearing cattle and tending their orchards. As experienced sellers at the Ludlow Food Festival they know that preparing plenty of samples and flavours of their award-winning ciders is likely to bring them the business their hoping for. Livestock farmers Joanne and Nigel from Powys have got all hands on deck to prepare their hot food stand for the festival

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team heads to Sandon Hall in Staffordshire, where items include an unusual French jardiniere and a silver tea service inscribed by football legend Stanley Matthews. Plus, a look at the work of photographer Patrick Lichfield

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: London Spirit v Oval Invincibles (Start-time 6.30pm). Isa Guha presents coverage of the men's match at Lord's, as both teams play their opening match of the competition. The Spirit beat the Invincibles by three runs at The Kia Oval last year and went on to reach the Eliminator, where they were defeated by Manchester Originals

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig looks at sideshows, stunts and scavenger hunts, with series regular Alan Davies, and guest panellists Gyles Brandreth, Rosie Jones and Nish Kumar

programme.title: A Bit of Fry and Laurie
programme.desc: Sketch comedy with Stephen Fry and Hugh Laurie. The duo demonstrate how to deal with trick-or-treaters, a German officer interrogates a British soldier and the over-dramatic businessmen are back. Originally broadcast in 1990

programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Reframed: Marilyn Monroe
programme.desc: Documentary examining the life of the actress, beginning as aspiring star Norma Jeane Baker attends an audition at 20th Century Fox, where the head of casting suggests she change her name to Marilyn Monroe. After connecting with Joseph Schenck, Marilyn is able to get a job at Columbia Pictures, where she receives her first starring role. Narrated by Jessica Chastain

programme.title: Reframed: Marilyn Monroe
programme.desc: Marilyn's rise is nearly ruined when news breaks that she posed nude for a calendar earlier in her career. She uses this to her advantage to showcase her body confidence. Monroe also demonstrates her unique talent for comedy in Gentlemen Prefer Blondes, and reaches superstar status

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Nick Ansell heads to the National Space Centre where astronomy enthusiast Derek Rowley talks about a project that's making the subject of space more accessible to deaf people. The programme also follows deaf mountaineer Morag Skelton as she climbs Scimitar Ridge in Glen Nevis, and Tyron Wolfe, who spent eight months journeying around South America, shares tips on travelling alone

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Caitriona and Kevin thought they had hit the property jackpot after moving from a tiny flat to a three-bedroom house in Rickmansworth, Herefordshire. But as they have discovered, there is no comfortable family space downstairs, the kitchen is cramped and their growing twins squabble over who has to sleep in the tiny box room every night. Enter architects Damion Burrows and Lynsey Elliott, who come up with alternative VR solutions to the couple's property problems - only one of which they can make a reality. Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Riya and Nanda have a sad and unloved garden in Groby, Leicestershire, with an outdated pink and yellow 'Battenburg' patio, a tumble down shed and a huge gravel slope. This really is a plot that needs to be rescued, especially as Riya is soon to be married and they are hoping to host some of the celebrations in the garden. Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam offer expert advice, which involves picking up on the reds and golds of Riya's wedding colours in the planting

programme.title: This Is BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the show from Hele in Devon, with the teams led by experts John Cameron and Stephanie Connell. Plus, Natasha learns about Mary Anning, the trailblazing fossil hunter

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive makes gelato and learns why it is healthier than ice cream, gets a makeover from Florence's most stylish man, and stays in a hotel that is a homage to Italian design

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: At RAF Lakenheath, Michael Portillo discovers a slice of America dropped into the British countryside. In the market town of Brandon on the border between Norfolk and Suffolk, he visits Quorn Foods to find how a seemingly modern meat substitute emerged out of a post-war food crisis. Michael ends his journey in Cambridge, where he studied during the 1970s

programme.title: Netball World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Australia v England (Centre-pass 8.00am). Live coverage of the Group F match at Cape Town International Convention Centre in South Africa

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Weather forecaster Carol Kirkwood takes a journey through the world of horticulture, receiving inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters. The series progresses in alphabetical order, and this programme features themes beginning with the letter A, and includes archive material from Gardeners' World, Countryfile and The Gardener's Year

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Korea Republic v Germany (Kick-off 11.00am). All the action from both teams' third and final match in Group H, held at Brisbane Stadium in Australia. Germany were champions in 2003 and 2007, while the Koreans' best showing was when they reached the last 16 in 2015. Gabby Logan presents, with analysis from Fara Williams and Jonas Eidevall, and commentary by Steve Wyeth and Anita Asante

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of the London 2012 Olympic Games, JS Haldane, Hancock's Half Hour, and John Wyndham's novels, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Scottish chefs serve up their music-themed mains and desserts, knowing that one of them will be eliminated from the competition at the end of this heat. Lorna McNee is confident of her lamb dish With A Little Help From My Friends, dedicated to supportive friends, while Gordon Jones chooses pigeon as the star of his dish Parklife, inspired by 1990s Britpop artists Blur. Meanwhile, Ben Reade comes up with Alan's Psychedelic Breakfast, which plays tribute to a Pink Floyd B-side

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Scottish region chefs must cook their four-course menus again, intending to take on board feedback from their earlier submissions. The duo need to impress food writer Matthew Fort, restaurateur Oliver Peyton, broadcaster and cook Andi Oliver, as well as guest judge Keisha Buchanan, the former member of one of Britain's most successful girl bands, the Sugababes

programme.title: World's Sneakiest Animals
programme.desc: Chris Packham features a host of animals that use deceptive tactics to find food. Some trick their prey, like the manipulative mantis which looks like a flower and killer whales which set traps using sound. Others cheat each other - sea otters demand ransoms after kidnapping each other's pups - and some, like African bird the drongo and monkeys, fool other species. In parks, meanwhile, grey squirrels are at war in stealing raids and it seems these animal liars, cheats and hustlers really will stop at nothing to get a meal

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Tracey and Graham became farmers 13 years ago, and have since invested everything to establish their thriving goat herd. They need to earn a living from their home-made goats cheese and soap, so Ripley Farmers' Market in Surrey is a vital lifeline. Run by volunteers, this village market has not only won awards but gives them out, and the pair receive some surprise news. Meanwhile, with a few hundred kilos of home-reared beef, pork and chicken in tow, young farmer Ellie's under pressure to get to the market on time, win over her customers and bank plenty of sales

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Coverage of day one of the annual World Track Championships, which takes place this year at the Sir Chris Hoy Velodrome in Glasgow. Great Britain won three golds, two silvers and five bronzes at the 2022 event in France and will be expecting to be even more of a threat on home territory. Clare Balding presents, with analysis from Sir Chris Hoy

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: The Fraserburgh crew race to save a stricken fishing boat without a working rudder in a force-eight gale. On Loch Ness, a yacht becomes trapped on a weir, and one wrong move by the lifeboat crew could send it over the edge. On the north Devon coast, the Minehead crew comes to the aid of a puppy that has swallowed a fishing hook

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: The chef continues his deep dive into the industry he knows and loves. This time, he meets brave and ambitious entrepreneurs looking to expand their businesses in the midst of some of the toughest economic conditions the industry has ever seen. In the high-risk game of hospitality, when do you twist, stick or fold?

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a cherry Bakewell factory in Stoke on Trent that produces 250,000 tarts every day, and meets the team of 12 employed to precisely place the cherries on top by hand. Cherry Healey learns the tricks of avoiding a soggy pastry bottom when baking at home, and visits a factory where almonds are roasted and milled to make butter. Historian Ruth Goodman discovers the origins of frangipane as a perfume in 17th-century Paris, and discovers how the modern cherry Bakewell recipe was arrived at by accident

programme.title: Goodness Gracious Me
programme.desc: The inaugural episode of the Asian sketch show, first aired in January 1998, starring Meera Syal, Sanjeev Bhaskar, Nina Wadia and Kulvinder Ghir. Highlights include life with the Coopers, nightclubbing with the Bhangramuffins, and why brown is the new black

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Natasha reveals her deepest fears. Kristi sheds light on Brock's betrayal. Orna reaches her limit with Sean's gaslighting

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham tells the story of how plant life turned Earth from a barren rock into a vibrant green world - a 4.5 billion-year saga of extraordinary highs and lows that almost wiped out all life. He revelas how a giant asteroid bombardment triggered Earth's plate tectonics, leading to huge fungi, soil and giant swamp forests, but the early plants locked in so much carbon dioxide that global temperatures suddenly plunged

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Painter Jemisha Maadhavji creates artwork of junior doctor Grace, who sustained a life-altering spinal cord injury during her studies when a man jumped from a third-floor balcony and landed on her. She discusses how using a wheelchair can be an advantage in her work in a busy London A&E department, as it places her at eye level to patients in their beds, allowing her to better connect with them

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team help an avid recycler whose small flat is bursting at the seams. With a limited budget and 24 hours, they transform the overflowing spare room into a dining area

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe presents the grand final, with judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young kicking things off by challenging the sewers to make a Victoriana-style evening dress. These dresses require delicate fabrics to create the glamorous effect, but they are tricky to handle. Next, it's the sewers' last chance to show off their instinct for design in the transformation challenge, as they attempt to turn female party wear into a glamorous men's red-carpet outfit. Finally, they fit a Met Gala-worthy 'two-in-one' dress for their models, who this week are a friend or family member

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits a two-bed bungalow in Lowestoft, Suffolk before catching up with two brothers renovating a Victorian building in Gorleston-on-Sea, Norfolk. Tommy Walsh is in Verney Junction, Buckinghamshire to hear about the development plans for a three-bed mid-terraced cottage

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine presents from the Antiques, Vintage and Collectors Fair in Detling, and finds out how retro computers are becoming collectable. With Irita Marriott and Nick Hall

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team reports from the biggest horticultural event in the north - the RHS Flower Show Tatton Park. Joe Swift and Frances Tophill reveal the latest in garden design, as well as bringing plant perfection from some of the best nurseries and growers in the country. Also, Nick Bailey shines a botanical spotlight on begonias, and Toby Buckland visits a Liverpool community who have regenerated their streets through collective gardening

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Seventeen contenders start this edition of the quiz, but how many of them will survive to face the 10,000 Question? Hosted by Rick Edwards

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of Tchaikovsky, the Evil Dead trilogy, Rafael Nadal, and This Country, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A stone carver, a fine art painter and a heraldic artist pitch ideas for a piece of art to celebrate the 850th anniversary of a Scottish castle. Hosted by Nick Knowles

programme.title: Netball World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of a play-off match (Centre-pass 3.00pm), held at Cape Town International Convention Centre in South Africa, as the team that finished third in Group F faces the fourth-placed nation in Group G

programme.title: Beechgrove Repotted
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes tours of some of Scotland's best-loved public gardens, including the Royal Botanic Gardens Edinburgh, Scone Palace's hedge maze and Branklyn Gardens

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Compilation edition revisiting some of the historic venues from the series and offering some new valuations and unexpected auctions. Paul Martin visits Rodmarton Manor, an extraordinary Arts and Crafts house in the Cotswolds

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents coverage of day two of the annual World Track Championships, which takes place this year at the Sir Chris Hoy Velodrome in Glasgow. The Great Britain quartet of Ethan Hayter, Oliver Wood, Ethan Vernon and Daniel Bigham won team pursuit gold in the corresponding session of last year's event in France

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson unearths the Suffolk village of Orford's history of defending the British Isles, and uncovers a local legend involving smugglers and the local pub

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: George Anderson and Carole Baxter harvest the first of this year's potato crop and also pick blackcurrants and gooseberries as well as giving an update on summer lawn care. There is a visit to a garden in Glasgow designed to assist people who have spinal injuries, while Brian Cunningham looks at ways to control pests and gets ready for some tree planting

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team celebrates people who are growing their own, from vegetables to flowers across the UK. At Longmeadow, Monty Don shares tips and advice on how to get the most out of the bargain plants available at this time of year. Joe Swift visits a community food-growing project in Bristol. And Rachel de Thame meets a cut flower-grower who started her own flower farm with no prior knowledge of growing

programme.title: Reframed: Marilyn Monroe
programme.desc: Marilyn is forging a new identity for herself in New York, but when news breaks that she plans to create her own production company, Darryl Zanuck refuses to let her out of her contract. Narrated by Jessica Chastain

programme.title: Reframed: Marilyn Monroe
programme.desc: In the final part of the series, Marilyn triumphs in her most celebrated comedy yet, Some Like It Hot. In the weeks before her death, she is on the cusp of a new and exciting future, making front pages with her portraits, and securing a triumphant new deal with 20th Century Fox. Narrated by Jessica Chastain

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: The chef continues his deep dive into the industry he knows and loves. This time, he meets brave and ambitious entrepreneurs looking to expand their businesses in the midst of some of the toughest economic conditions the industry has ever seen. In the high-risk game of hospitality, when do you twist, stick or fold?

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Debra from Wigan, Greater Manchester, wants her new build plot to be transformed into a calming zen garden for relaxation and contemplation. She'd also like it to be low maintenance and maximise the views from the woodland beyond. Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill try to bring her vision to life on a budget of 6,000

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: On a trip to the Peak District, Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr begin take to the water on the River Derwent. Josh and Mark's kayak down the rapids becomes a no-holds-barred race, leaving one triumphant and the other fuming. Mark Sr meanwhile takes a more relaxed journey downstream, taking in the scenery from the comfort of a rubber ring. Next stop is the town of Bakewell, where they sample its famous sweet delicacies. That night they set up camp and as the sun sets, Josh reveals how he's feeling about his footballing career drawing to a close and his fears for the future

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in the North Yorkshire seaside resort of Scarborough to explore one of the greatest royal fortresses in England

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: A misunderstanding sends Nadine into an emotional state. Orna struggles to get Sean to be honest. Deep fissures in Brock and Kristi's relationship emerge

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Natasha reveals her deepest fears. Kristi sheds light on Brock's betrayal. Orna reaches her limit with Sean's gaslighting

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels by train north from Inverness to the Orkney Islands. Beginning on the Moray Firth, Michael admires the Cullen Viaduct then enjoys a bowl of Cullen skink at a family-run fishmonger of 150 years' standing. In the factory smokery, he learns from the owner how the famous soup acquires its distinctive taste

programme.title: Secrets of Skin
programme.desc: Biologist Ben Garrod explores the armour and weaponry vertebrate skin has adapted to deploy, from quills to deadly toxins and camouflage

programme.title: Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise
programme.desc: The documentary offering a glimpse into the rarely seen South American wilderness continues, this time following the path of the relentless wind sweeping east through Patagonia's dry desert from the Andes' peaks. The programme reveals a weird world of maras - a large relative of the guinea pig - and penguins, and witnesses the first faltering steps of baby guanacos - Patagonia's very own camels. Cameras also observe the people who have taken on this inhospitable environment and carved out a home for themselves. Santiago Cabrera narrates

programme.title: Immortal Egypt with Joann Fletcher
programme.desc: The historian reveals hows Egypt's enemies exploited a country weakened by internal strife, travelling south to Sudan to examine the story of the forgotten Nubian kings, who ruled Egypt from their southern homeland for a century, even building their own pyramids to bury their monarchs. She then explores how the next group of invaders the Saites took the tradition of mummification to new extremes by preserving millions of animals, before Alexander the Great came to Egypt's rescue and founded the greatest city on Earth

programme.title: Martin Amis, Money and Memories with William Boyd
programme.desc: Novelist William Boyd looks back on his long friendship with fellow writer Martin Amis, who died in May this year at the age of 73. He focuses on what many consider to be Amis's most successful work, 1984's Money, which introduced readers to the hedonistic would-be film-maker John Self, and was adapted by the BBC in 2010

programme.title: Money
programme.desc: British commercial-maker John Self travels to America to direct a feature film, with backing from financial high-flyer Fielding Goodney. As he hurls himself into a life of near-total excess, the project becomes plagued by conflicts among the cast - and John becomes the target of a menacing stalker. First in a two-part adaptation of Martin Amis's darkly comic novel, starring Nick Frost, Vincent Kartheiser and Jerry Hall. First shown in 2010

programme.title: Money
programme.desc: Conclusion. John is angry when the script finally arrives and he discovers his original vision has disappeared, so he decides to rewrite it himself. His new version is a success, gaining the praise of Fielding and the cast, but the mysterious caller keeps drawing nearer, and the appearance of a red-headed woman who resembles his mother complicates matters. Adaptation of Martin Amis's novel, starring Nick Frost and Vincent Kartheiser. First shown in 2010

programme.title: Mark Lawson Talks To
programme.desc: The cultural commentator interviews the author, whose works include Money and London Fields. Amis discusses his relationship with his father Kingsley, and reveals how his sister Sally's struggles in life influenced his novel The Pregnant Widow

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels by train north from Inverness to the Orkney Islands. Beginning on the Moray Firth, Michael admires the Cullen Viaduct then enjoys a bowl of Cullen skink at a family-run fishmonger of 150 years' standing. In the factory smokery, he learns from the owner how the famous soup acquires its distinctive taste

programme.title: Secrets of Skin
programme.desc: Biologist Ben Garrod explores the armour and weaponry vertebrate skin has adapted to deploy, from quills to deadly toxins and camouflage

programme.title: Immortal Egypt with Joann Fletcher
programme.desc: The historian reveals hows Egypt's enemies exploited a country weakened by internal strife, travelling south to Sudan to examine the story of the forgotten Nubian kings, who ruled Egypt from their southern homeland for a century, even building their own pyramids to bury their monarchs. She then explores how the next group of invaders the Saites took the tradition of mummification to new extremes by preserving millions of animals, before Alexander the Great came to Egypt's rescue and founded the greatest city on Earth

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's Scottish coastal railway journey reaches Invergordon on the Cromarty Firth, the third great inlet on the northeast coast of the Highlands. He arrives on Britain's northernmost railway, the Far North Line, and heads straight onto the water to explore a former oil drilling rig now moored in the firth

programme.title: Secrets of Skin
programme.desc: Wherever they live, skin is critical in allowing animals to sense the world around them. Even the toughest of animals, Crocodilians, have a surprisingly sensitive side when it comes to their specialised skin sensors they use to detect the tiniest of ripples in the water. Deadly Pit Vipers use heat sensors to ambush the small rodents they feed on. Ben Garrod puts them to the test with an experiment to see if they will strike a cold or warm ping-pong ball. He also uncovers how the leaf nosed bat puts its facial skin to good use as an acoustic lens to echolocate around its dense forest habitat

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Documentary focusing on the female stars of the Hollywood studio era, from its beginnings around 1910 through to its collapse in the early 1960s. Screen icons chronologically recalled include Theda Bara, Lillian Gish, Clara Bow, Louise Brooks, Marlene Dietrich, Greta Garbo, Joan Crawford, Bette Davis, Rita Hayworth, Ava Gardner, Elizabeth Taylor and Marilyn Monroe

programme.title: Gentlemen Prefer Blondes (1953)
programme.desc: Lounge singers Lorelei and Dorothy embark on a transatlantic cruise to Paris in search of rich husbands. While Dorothy falls for a penniless man, Lorelei thinks she has found the millionaire of her dreams, only for his father to hire a private eye to spy on her and prove she is a gold-digger. Howard Hawks' musical comedy, starring Marilyn Monroe, Jane Russell, Charles Coburn and Elliott Reid

programme.title: Brief Encounter (1945)
programme.desc: A suburban housewife meets a married doctor by chance in a railway station waiting room. Later, their paths cross many times until the pair become friends and their meetings a fixed arrangement. But as their feelings for each other transform from friendship into passion, both come to realise the affair is doomed to fail. David Lean's romantic drama, starring Celia Johnson and Trevor Howard

programme.title: The RKO Story: Tales from Hollywood
programme.desc: Ed Asner tells the story of RKO Pictures film production and distribution company through the eyes of the people who worked there from its creation at the start of the talkies in the late 1920s. First shown in 1987

programme.title: The RKO Story: Tales from Hollywood
programme.desc: Ed Asner explores the studio's Thirties musicals featuring Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers. Included are interviews with producer Pando Berman and choreographer Hermes Pan. First shown in 1987

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Sebastiaan's making a South African bobotie, which is a local dish his family have shared with him. He starts by putting chopped spring onions, grated courgette, turmeric powder, ground coriander and torn red pepper into a casserole dish and cooking them. He then adds garlic puree, ginger puree, chutney and chopped tomatoes to cooked beef mince. Sebastiaan then carefully makes powder out of his special ingredient, cumin seeds, and adds the powder to the beef mixture. Sebastiaan mixes both the vegetables and the beef in an oven dish and flattens them before adding two bay leaves. He adds a topping of milk and egg and then places it in the oven. Sebastiaan has a wonderfully decorated table, and he has another traditional treat to go with his bobotie. Will his friends figure out what his special ingredient is?

programme.desc: Reality star Dani Dyer, actor James Buckley, comedian Marcus Brigstocke, former Gogglebox star Mica Ven and TV and radio presenter Richie Anderson compete in the first heat of the celebrity contest. The first challenge sees the contestants each given a different ingredient to showcase in a single dish. Then they have to make a main course and a dessert for a dinner party, knowing that John Torode and Gregg Wallace will be sending one of them home

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Walescast
programme.desc: BBC Wales politics editor Felicity Evans and political correspondent James Williams present interviews with MPs and analysis from experts about what is happening in the world of Welsh politics

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena and Amy meet a white industry executive famed for successful films and TV shows with black talent. Kwabena persuades him to read his script, only to suspect that his ideas have been stolen. Kwabena also meets Vanessa's wealthy friends, Amy continues to struggle with microaggressions at work, and Maurice decides to go vegan. Guest starring Jessica Hynes and Isy Suttie

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Funmi goes into labour, but when the doctors refuse to listen to her concerns, she ends up forced into an emergency c-section that leaves her life hanging in the balance. A baby on the way means Kwabena desperately needs somewhere new to live, but given his financial situation, and the housing crisis in London, it's proving difficult. Stephanie is worried about her son, a cheeky, aspiring rapper who has fallen in with the wrong crowd

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: Two Police Community Support Officers find themselves caught in a web of lies designed to discredit their colleague, a tip-off leads to police cracking a 2million insurance scam and a married couple take advantage of thousands of concert-goers with extortionate ticket prices

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The vet is called when Violet the koala goes downhill, while Iggy Pop the iguana has a mystery tail injury that requires surgery - but at his age an operation is a risky business

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin follow the progress of properties in Rugby in Warwickshire, Doncaster in South Yorkshire and Tylorstown in south Wales

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The red and blue teams vie at Brighton Racecourse, East Sussex, hunting for items of value with the help of experts Catherine Southon and Mark Stacey. Presenter Christina Trevanion maintains order and also gets to meet a gramophone guru, learning how to spot the difference between an authentic gramophone and a replica

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the rich and diverse history of West Penwith, the farthest point west in mainland Britain. He visits Lamorna Cove, made famous through song and art, and the Unesco-protected tin and copper mining area of Botallack, where he talks to a mining explorer. The chef also follows an ancient track in search of Cornwall's oldest building and reveals how, as a young lad on the Lizard Peninsula, he fell in love for the first time and tasted his first French fish stew - known as a bouillabaisse

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor is joined by crime fiction author LJ Ross on a trip along the Northumbrian Coast. The duo visit Holy Island - the setting for the writer's first novel - where they join a tour guide to find out more about the religious connections with the area. The actor is then joined by his partner Zoila for a caravan stay on a cattle farm before taking to the skies in a lightweight aircraft

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple planning to start a cookery school in Shropshire to find a new home, while also visiting a local farm that provides produce for local restaurants

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Aspiring makers are given the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses, joining Dom Chinea at a training camp in the grounds of an Arts and Crafts house in Leicestershire. Izzy has given up a career in advertising to try to become a full-time potter. Stone carver Luke needs help overcoming a serious confidence problem that is holding him back

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Roo Irvine and Mark Hill scour the Highlands and Islands for antiques, visiting northerly village John O'Groats. A leather case hides a secret and reveals a profit, for one expert, and some 1950s fun excites the other

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the usual mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Bobby tells Anna the truth about Lucy's death and Sonia panics as she thinks she might be pregnant. Honey is starting to pick up on Ben's discomfort around food. Anna agrees to stop her search for their mum if Gina agrees to give up drugs for good

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The heats continue with the pairs challenge, which sees the remaining candidates split into teams of two, each tasked with cooking a dish identical in both appearance and flavour. This is followed by a busy lunchtime service in a professional kitchen and a new challenge in which they must cook a dish that they would serve from their own dream food truck

programme.title: Slammed: The Seventies
programme.desc: Documentary focusing on the Wales rugby union team in the 1970s. The national rugby team has lost its sparkle and the Welsh Rugby Union puts its faith in a group of talented young players, but with the best team in the world coming to Wales, a radical decision changes their fortunes

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: The team members try to solve the eight-decade-old murder of Joyce Cox. After the four-year-old disappeared in 1939, her body was found on a railway line just a few hundred yards from her home in Whitchurch - though her killer was never caught. Despite the passage of time, new evidence comes to light that might help the team finally solve the case as the last person to see Joyce alive talks for the first time about that day

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Richard Osman delves into his Brighton roots and is astonished to discover how his four-times great grandfather turned amateur sleuth and ended up entangled in one of the city's most notorious murder trials. The quiz show presenter, TV producer and crime writer also investigates his grandfather's army career and learns why it gave him a profound belief in the power of education, which he passed on to his grandson

programme.title: Gaia: A Death on Dancing Ledge
programme.desc: Zara McDermott investigates a mysterious death from 2017, in which a 19-year-old from Dorset ran away from home in a state of distress. Her body would later be found in the undergrowth by a massive search operation, having died of hypothermia. The first episode examines the early clues that were discovered and the suspicion that fell on a childhood friend and his grandmother, before they were released without charge

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Premier League striker Kevin Campbell, European champion sprinter Adam Gemili, Ashes-winning cricketer Ashley Giles and world 800m and 4x400m bronze medallist Jenny Meadows join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: A series of burglaries allows police to crack county-lines drug-dealing conspiracy, a consumer complaint brings down a national SMS fraud and a jet-setting con-woman is brought to justice

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble meet the newest diva at the Park - Inny the giant otter, while Jean Johansson discovers why koalas can sometimes hamper Australian detectives. Plus, the Park is placed on red alert as one of the carnivores goes missing

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Jacqui Joseph follow the fortunes of a terrace in Aberdare, south Wales, a slice of land in Glasgow and an end terrace in Rochester, Kent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles is in Kingston in Surrey, where the teams are led by Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe. While the competition hots up, Eric gets on his bike at the Herne Hill Velodrome

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: As the chef's Cornish odyssey nears its end, he takes a break in the city of Truro, where he discovers an unusual ghost story and tours the magnificent cathedral. He also meets a family passionate about offal, who prepare Rick a meal of pickled ox tongue and beef heart tacos, and in the county's most northerly parish he tells the story of an eccentric vicar who would retrieve the bodies from nearby shipwrecks and bury them in his church graveyard

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor is joined by Hairy Biker Si King on his quest to find new ways of spending time in the great outdoors. Taking the scenic route north to Chillingham, the pair head out to visit the estate's famous wild cattle

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a family with two children to find a home in Devon with a large garden, and discovers an approach to woodcraft that uses steam to sculpt interior design pieces

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Aspiring makers are given the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. With chronic fatigue syndrome, autism and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder Dea is hoping her willow-weaving can help her build a home business. For artistically inclined Gemma, it's all about proving her careers advisor wrong. Dom Chinea presents

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The Isle of Skye hosts Roo Irvine and Mark Hill, where a sweet bonbon dish and a collection of glass go to auction while a clan chieftain's secret weapon is revealed. As the last auction approaches, it remains to be seen whether Mark will win his debut trip - or whether Roo will manage to snatch victory at the last

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Lucy Porter joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a lively mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Snowdon, or Yr Wyddfa, is the most popular mountain in Britain, attracting three-quarters of a million visitors each year - and it only getting busier. This documentary follows the work that goes in to keeping the tourists happy, including the maintenance of the five-mile mountain railway, which not only carries visitors but also supplies to the shop and cafe and even water and waste to and from the toilets. Meanwhile, wardens patrol the mountain to ensure the safety of walkers, and volunteers spends their weekends collecting tons of discarded rubbish

programme.title: Wrexham: Hollywood or Bust!
programme.desc: Wrexham AFC are one of the oldest football clubs in the world, with a home in the Racecourse Ground that dates back virtually to the dawn of the sport. Theirs is a history that stretches back further than most, with drama and memorable moments to rival any club. This documentary recounts that history, while revealing why promotion to the Football League under Hollywood-based owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney would mean so much to the club's fans

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining celebrities take part in their final challenge, for which they cook a two-course meal that will be judged not only by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also Celebrity MasterChef Champions Angellica Bell (2017) and Lisa Snowdon (2022) and 2022 finalist Danny Jones. The best will go through to the semi-final. The others will be hanging up their MasterChef aprons

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee goes to watch Benji playing football for a local under-13 team and is unable to restrain himself on the touchline and becomes the competitive dad that all other parents want to avoid. Undaunted by the disapproval of Toby, who coaches the team, Lee sets about rigging the vote for the player of the year. With a guest appearance from veteran actor Melvyn Hayes

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: The morning after the night before has not started well. Diane is worried that she did not impress the school governors, Kath is revealing more than she should to the women in the old people's home and Martin is desperately trying to get his hands on a chunk of cash

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rewind: 60 Years of Welsh Pop
programme.desc: A celebration of Rhyl rockers the Alarm as they celebrate 40 years in the music industry, with performances and exclusive footage from the band's personal archive, including their biggest hits and solo appearances from frontman Mike Peters

programme.title: Ready Player One (2018)
programme.desc: In 2045, gamers explore a virtual world in the quest for a deceased tycoon's fortune. However, they must also contend with an evil corporation who will stop at nothing to get their hands on the prize. Steven Spielberg's fantasy adventure based on Ernest Cline's novel, starring Tye Sheridan, Olivia Cooke, Ben Mendelsohn, Simon Pegg and Mark Rylance

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: An unusual licence plate helps police crack an international smuggling operation and a call about a disturbance leads officers to discover a huge haul of firearms. A group of youths smoking cannabis leads to the solving of a string of robberies

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes in Koala Creek as kidney disease claims the life of Wilpena, but there is also happier news on the marsupial front when Ben and Kate catch up with wallaby Newt

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits a grand five-bedroom Victorian terrace in Brighton. Plus, the progress of houses in Beeston in Nottinghamshire and Welwyn Garden City in Hertfordshire

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts David Harper and Raj Bisram guide the red and the blue teams around Ardingly Antiques Fair, West Sussex, before the teams take their items to auction. Natasha also visits an elaborate well, a gift from a Maharajah, opened in 1864

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits Tintagel, Cornwall's most mythical place, which was an important trading port with Europe and the birthplace of perhaps Britain's greatest legend - the tale of King Arthur. He also learns how the Methodists were important to Cornwall, and how they would cook a rather unusual bun during feast days, and meets a family on the Roseland Peninsula who are continuing the surprisingly ancient tradition of growing an exotic spice - saffron

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Former Emmerdale actress Charlie Hardwick shows Robson the hidden gems of the East Durham coastline. The pair take an art class on the sand, a wellness choir teacher shows how singing outdoors can be good for mind and body, and Robson signs up for a session with a forest bathing instructor among the trees of Hamsterley Forest

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a retired couple who want to find a property in the Welsh Borders, preferably with holiday let potential or space for a glamping, on a budget of 1million

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Labourer Mike has a passion for turning wooden bowls but feels held back by his perfectionist attitude to his creations. During the pandemic Sarah quit her job and took up pottery but has been struggling to make enough money from it to live on. With the help and advice of Dom Chinea and his team of experts, Mike and Sarah try their best to create smooth running businesses out of their crafts and turn their hobbies into a day job

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Roo Irvine and Mark Hill continue their Scottish jaunt as a 1970s Triumph transports the duo to shops scattered throughout the Highlands. A Georgian silver brooch gives veteran Tripper Roo something solemn to think about, but a rather unorthodox key rack, she hopes, will unlock some big profits. Meanwhile, rookie Tripper Mark continues to buy like an old hand as he finds a wooden sculpture of a naked torso that makes for an exhilarating auction

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Freddie meets his dad and Kat finally tells him the truth. Elaine hatches a plan to get the Knight sisters to steal customers from the Albert but Gina is rattled when Anna brings up their mum again

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts revive a theatre chair from Derby Hippodrome, restore a unique and whimsical timepiece, and resurrect a cherished bronze locket

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk visit Carol and her sons Keith and Thomas in Northamptonshire to help declutter after the death of husband and father John, an avid antiques collector. They set up their pop-up auction at the Avoncroft Museum of Historic Buildings in hope of finding the right bidders for John's collection. Carol plans to use any profits to renovate a memorial spot in her garden
