programme.desc: In 2045, gamers explore a virtual world in the quest for a deceased tycoon's fortune. However, they must also contend with an evil corporation who will stop at nothing to get their hands on the prize. Steven Spielberg's fantasy adventure based on Ernest Cline's novel, starring Tye Sheridan, Olivia Cooke, Ben Mendelsohn, Simon Pegg and Mark Rylance

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: An unusual licence plate helps police crack an international smuggling operation and a call about a disturbance leads officers to discover a huge haul of firearms. A group of youths smoking cannabis leads to the solving of a string of robberies

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes in Koala Creek as kidney disease claims the life of Wilpena, but there is also happier news on the marsupial front when Ben and Kate catch up with wallaby Newt

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits a grand five-bedroom Victorian terrace in Brighton. Plus, the progress of houses in Beeston in Nottinghamshire and Welwyn Garden City in Hertfordshire

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts David Harper and Raj Bisram guide the red and the blue teams around Ardingly Antiques Fair, West Sussex, before the teams take their items to auction. Natasha also visits an elaborate well, a gift from a Maharajah, opened in 1864

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits Tintagel, Cornwall's most mythical place, which was an important trading port with Europe and the birthplace of perhaps Britain's greatest legend - the tale of King Arthur. He also learns how the Methodists were important to Cornwall, and how they would cook a rather unusual bun during feast days, and meets a family on the Roseland Peninsula who are continuing the surprisingly ancient tradition of growing an exotic spice - saffron

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Former Emmerdale actress Charlie Hardwick shows Robson the hidden gems of the East Durham coastline. The pair take an art class on the sand, a wellness choir teacher shows how singing outdoors can be good for mind and body, and Robson signs up for a session with a forest bathing instructor among the trees of Hamsterley Forest

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a retired couple who want to find a property in the Welsh Borders, preferably with holiday let potential or space for a glamping, on a budget of 1million

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Labourer Mike has a passion for turning wooden bowls but feels held back by his perfectionist attitude to his creations. During the pandemic Sarah quit her job and took up pottery but has been struggling to make enough money from it to live on. With the help and advice of Dom Chinea and his team of experts, Mike and Sarah try their best to create smooth running businesses out of their crafts and turn their hobbies into a day job

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Roo Irvine and Mark Hill continue their Scottish jaunt as a 1970s Triumph transports the duo to shops scattered throughout the Highlands. A Georgian silver brooch gives veteran Tripper Roo something solemn to think about, but a rather unorthodox key rack, she hopes, will unlock some big profits. Meanwhile, rookie Tripper Mark continues to buy like an old hand as he finds a wooden sculpture of a naked torso that makes for an exhilarating auction

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Lucy Porter joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Ronan Keating present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Freddie meets his dad and Kat finally tells him the truth. Elaine hatches a plan to get the Knight sisters to steal customers from the Albert but Gina is rattled when Anna brings up their mum again

programme.title: Barra's Return of the Wild
programme.desc: Barra Best meets one of the volunteers ensuring the Northern Bald Ibis continues to exist in the German town of Burghausen. Off the coast of County Kerry, Ireland, investigations are carried out into the presence of super-sized oysters in the Atlantic Ocean and the part they play in saving the oceans' diversity. A group of bison in Sweden are relocated to the wilds of Romania

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Photographer Brock Elbank takes images of Araf, Scotland's first Asian paramedic, who also works with local mosques and gurdwaras, equipping them with first-aid knowledge and providing a bridge between communities. Brock's photographic projects focus on idiosyncratic and unique features, such as scars, birthmarks and skin conditions such as vitiligo, to capture the private stories behind a public persona

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Reality star Dani Dyer, actor James Buckley, comedian Marcus Brigstocke, former Gogglebox star Mica Ven and TV and radio presenter Richie Anderson compete in the first heat of the celebrity contest. The first challenge sees the contestants each given a different ingredient to showcase in a single dish. Then they have to make a main course and a dessert for a dinner party, knowing that John Torode and Gregg Wallace will be sending one of them home

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Ulster By the Sea
programme.desc: Jon thanks the managers at Shanlieve caravan park in Cranfield for saving his life after he suffered a heart attack two years ago. Catherine and Rick, also at Cranfield, go out to award the annual best-kept caravan prizes, while their son Miles goes paddle-boarding with his friends. Jo's family enjoy a summer of harbour jumping at Carnlough and Colin takes to the road in his brightly painted caravan

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena and Amy meet a white industry executive famed for successful films and TV shows with black talent. Kwabena persuades him to read his script, only to suspect that his ideas have been stolen. Kwabena also meets Vanessa's wealthy friends, Amy continues to struggle with microaggressions at work, and Maurice decides to go vegan. Guest starring Jessica Hynes and Isy Suttie

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Funmi goes into labour, but when the doctors refuse to listen to her concerns, she ends up forced into an emergency c-section that leaves her life hanging in the balance. A baby on the way means Kwabena desperately needs somewhere new to live, but given his financial situation, and the housing crisis in London, it's proving difficult. Stephanie is worried about her son, a cheeky, aspiring rapper who has fallen in with the wrong crowd

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Premier League striker Kevin Campbell, European champion sprinter Adam Gemili, Ashes-winning cricketer Ashley Giles and world 800m and 4x400m bronze medallist Jenny Meadows join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: Two Police Community Support Officers find themselves caught in a web of lies designed to discredit their colleague, a tip-off leads to police cracking a 2million insurance scam and a married couple take advantage of thousands of concert-goers with extortionate ticket prices

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The vet is called when Violet the koala goes downhill, while Iggy Pop the iguana has a mystery tail injury that requires surgery - but at his age an operation is a risky business

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin follow the progress of properties in Rugby in Warwickshire, Doncaster in South Yorkshire and Tylorstown in south Wales

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The red and blue teams vie at Brighton Racecourse, East Sussex, hunting for items of value with the help of experts Catherine Southon and Mark Stacey. Presenter Christina Trevanion maintains order and also gets to meet a gramophone guru, learning how to spot the difference between an authentic gramophone and a replica

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the rich and diverse history of West Penwith, the farthest point west in mainland Britain. He visits Lamorna Cove, made famous through song and art, and the Unesco-protected tin and copper mining area of Botallack, where he talks to a mining explorer. The chef also follows an ancient track in search of Cornwall's oldest building and reveals how, as a young lad on the Lizard Peninsula, he fell in love for the first time and tasted his first French fish stew - known as a bouillabaisse

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor is joined by crime fiction author LJ Ross on a trip along the Northumbrian Coast. The duo visit Holy Island - the setting for the writer's first novel - where they join a tour guide to find out more about the religious connections with the area. The actor is then joined by his partner Zoila for a caravan stay on a cattle farm before taking to the skies in a lightweight aircraft

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple planning to start a cookery school in Shropshire to find a new home, while also visiting a local farm that provides produce for local restaurants

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Aspiring makers are given the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses, joining Dom Chinea at a training camp in the grounds of an Arts and Crafts house in Leicestershire. Izzy has given up a career in advertising to try to become a full-time potter. Stone carver Luke needs help overcoming a serious confidence problem that is holding him back

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Roo Irvine and Mark Hill scour the Highlands and Islands for antiques, visiting northerly village John O'Groats. A leather case hides a secret and reveals a profit, for one expert, and some 1950s fun excites the other

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Lucy Porter joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the usual mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Bobby tells Anna the truth about Lucy's death and Sonia panics as she thinks she might be pregnant. Honey is starting to pick up on Ben's discomfort around food. Anna agrees to stop her search for their mum if Gina agrees to give up drugs for good

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The heats continue with the pairs challenge, which sees the remaining candidates split into teams of two, each tasked with cooking a dish identical in both appearance and flavour. This is followed by a busy lunchtime service in a professional kitchen and a new challenge in which they must cook a dish that they would serve from their own dream food truck

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Richard Osman delves into his Brighton roots and is astonished to discover how his four-times great grandfather turned amateur sleuth and ended up entangled in one of the city's most notorious murder trials. The quiz show presenter, TV producer and crime writer also investigates his grandfather's army career and learns why it gave him a profound belief in the power of education, which he passed on to his grandson

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Paddy Raff Show
programme.desc: The Belfast stand-up fronts sketches featuring brand-new characters alongside household favourites, showcasing his unique and quirky take on modern life. Father Pat begins hosting online wedding ceremonies allowing the happy couple and their guests to choose the soundtrack to their nuptials. Granny Raff continues to set the world to rights from her living room and tries to use her powers of persuasion to get herself vaccinated against Covid

programme.title: Schindler's List (1993)
programme.desc: In German-occupied Poland during the Second World War, businessman and Nazi Party member Oskar Schindler is deeply affected when he witnesses the clearing of the Krakow Ghetto. He decides to try to save Jews destined for the concentration camps by employing them in his factory - an act of mercy made possible by a deal struck with a sadistic German commandant. Steven Spielberg's Oscar-winning drama, starring Liam Neeson, Ben Kingsley and Ralph Fiennes

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: A series of burglaries allows police to crack county-lines drug-dealing conspiracy, a consumer complaint brings down a national SMS fraud and a jet-setting con-woman is brought to justice

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble meet the newest diva at the Park - Inny the giant otter, while Jean Johansson discovers why koalas can sometimes hamper Australian detectives. Plus, the Park is placed on red alert as one of the carnivores goes missing

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Jacqui Joseph follow the fortunes of a terrace in Aberdare, south Wales, a slice of land in Glasgow and an end terrace in Rochester, Kent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles is in Kingston in Surrey, where the teams are led by Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe. While the competition hots up, Eric gets on his bike at the Herne Hill Velodrome

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: As the chef's Cornish odyssey nears its end, he takes a break in the city of Truro, where he discovers an unusual ghost story and tours the magnificent cathedral. He also meets a family passionate about offal, who prepare Rick a meal of pickled ox tongue and beef heart tacos, and in the county's most northerly parish he tells the story of an eccentric vicar who would retrieve the bodies from nearby shipwrecks and bury them in his church graveyard

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor is joined by Hairy Biker Si King on his quest to find new ways of spending time in the great outdoors. Taking the scenic route north to Chillingham, the pair head out to visit the estate's famous wild cattle

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a family with two children to find a home in Devon with a large garden, and discovers an approach to woodcraft that uses steam to sculpt interior design pieces

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Aspiring makers are given the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. With chronic fatigue syndrome, autism and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder Dea is hoping her willow-weaving can help her build a home business. For artistically inclined Gemma, it's all about proving her careers advisor wrong. Dom Chinea presents

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The Isle of Skye hosts Roo Irvine and Mark Hill, where a sweet bonbon dish and a collection of glass go to auction while a clan chieftain's secret weapon is revealed. As the last auction approaches, it remains to be seen whether Mark will win his debut trip - or whether Roo will manage to snatch victory at the last

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Lucy Porter joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a lively mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Snowdon, or Yr Wyddfa, is the most popular mountain in Britain, attracting three-quarters of a million visitors each year - and it only getting busier. This documentary follows the work that goes in to keeping the tourists happy, including the maintenance of the five-mile mountain railway, which not only carries visitors but also supplies to the shop and cafe and even water and waste to and from the toilets. Meanwhile, wardens patrol the mountain to ensure the safety of walkers, and volunteers spends their weekends collecting tons of discarded rubbish

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: British athletics great Roger Black, former Premier League midfielder Steve Sidwell, Paralympian-turned-broadcaster Ade Adepitan and Olympic gold medal-winning hockey player Alex Danson-Bennett join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining celebrities take part in their final challenge, for which they cook a two-course meal that will be judged not only by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also Celebrity MasterChef Champions Angellica Bell (2017) and Lisa Snowdon (2022) and 2022 finalist Danny Jones. The best will go through to the semi-final. The others will be hanging up their MasterChef aprons

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee goes to watch Benji playing football for a local under-13 team and is unable to restrain himself on the touchline and becomes the competitive dad that all other parents want to avoid. Undaunted by the disapproval of Toby, who coaches the team, Lee sets about rigging the vote for the player of the year. With a guest appearance from veteran actor Melvyn Hayes

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: The morning after the night before has not started well. Diane is worried that she did not impress the school governors, Kath is revealing more than she should to the women in the old people's home and Martin is desperately trying to get his hands on a chunk of cash

programme.title: Scandalous: Phone Hacking on Trial
programme.desc: A look at the bitter legal battle taking place for a decade over allegations of unlawful information gathering at some of Britain's biggest newspaper groups. programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

In the lead-up to his latest attempt he records his slow, steady progress, the cancellations, postponements, accidents and frustrations that met him along the way, and also the sheer elation of finally setting out to sea. programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at autumn in the northern hemisphere and spring in the south, seasons of change that bring opportunities, but also huge challenges. By September temperatures in northern Canada can plummet as low as -20C, but there is one stretch of river that still flows and bears are able to fish for the final salmon of the season. In southern Africa the rains have been gone for many months and watering holes have all-but dried up, while a king penguin chick on Marion Island answers the call of the ocean

With access to the South Wales Police's Major Crimes Unit, detectives try to identify the killer through CCTV footage in the hours before and after June's death

Starring Bradley Walsh and Paul Nicholls

programme.desc: An armed robbery ends in murder and Frost wastes no time in arresting a known crook he saw at the scene during the getaway, convinced he is one of the men responsible. With this little mystery to solve, as well as a case of four burglaries in as many days at the same house, the dogged policeman's lot proves a busy one indeed. David Jason stars, with Billy Murray and James Hayes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Oscar finds himself in an awkward position when the police investigate a warehouse robbery. A lost property clear-out at the police station gives David a new hobby, but he soon manages to cause trouble. Starring Derek Fowlds and David Lonsdale

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Merton investigates a suspicious death with the help of CID and Walker begins to suspect a poacher may be involved. Vernon tempts fate by employing a new mechanic for the garage without asking Bernie and attempts to recreate a traditional dance at the town fete. Guest starring Hannah Gordon

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa and Martin search for a nursery now that Janice has left, and Mrs Tishell is shocked to find out that Al has very high blood pressure. Louisa also helps with the diagnosis of a pupil, which spurs her on to explore the possibilities of a change of career. This is not welcome news for Martin, who dislikes any kind of change, even if it could be for the better. Elsewhere, Ruth is approached about selling her farm. Starring Martin Clunes, Caroline Catz, Selina Cadell and Ian McNeice

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The curmudgeonly GP is perturbed when he discovers Louisa, who is already spending much of her time away from home, has applied to take up a child and adolescent counselling course. However, achieving a work-life balance is far from the greatest of concerns for some of the Ellinghams' neighbours, not least of whom is Al, whose plans to demonstrate his business acumen are placed in jeopardy when Ken decides to close the pub. Unless Ruth agrees to serve as a guarantor, Ken will not allow Morwenna and Al to take over the establishment, so the pair arrange a race-walking event to raise funds and prove the community is on their side

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: The murder of a caretaker has been so carefully planned and executed that the police are left without a single piece of evidence. Adding to the mystery is the fact that the crime is laid out in detail in a manual purchased three weeks earlier in the victim's name. Brooks and Casey eventually track down the killer, who confesses, but the trial is put in jeopardy by a canny defence lawyer. Guest starring Toby Stephens

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Julia McKenzie returns as the sleuthing spinster in the first of three murder mysteries. While staying at a hotel in the Caribbean, Miss Marple investigates the death of a fellow guest, refusing to believe he died of a heart attack. With the help of a business tycoon she sets about finding the real cause of the man's demise, and is soon drawn into a web of deceit and dark magic. Adapted by Charlie Higson and co-starring Antony Sher, Robert Webb, Montserrat Lombard, Daniel Rigby, Hermione Norris, MyAnna Buring, Warren Brown and Oliver Ford Davies

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon and Oliver forge an uneasy pact when they learn that Lyn is pregnant, but tensions arise when they are interviewed on a local radio station

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon and Oliver return to a bachelor existence, now that their children have finally flown the coop. Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies star

programme.desc: Laurel and Ashley continue to enjoy the novelty of being a couple, while Nicola begins to question her relationship with Simon

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Simon rejects Nicola's attempts to change him, and Carl leaps into action when he spots a vandal in the haulage yard

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity collapses and is rushed to hospital for an emergency Caesarean. Zoe puts the kybosh on Tom's plans once again and Ashley's cooking proves to be Laurel's undoing

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity causes uproar by announcing she intends to have her baby adopted, and Laurel goes into hiding, prompting Nicola to take action

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: While Simon delves into genealogy, Oliver prepares to add to his customers none other than HRH The Prince of Wales. Comedy, starring Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Caroline asks the feuding pair to supply the entertainment for her charity luncheon, but soon regrets her decision. Comedy, starring Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: An accident at the harbour leaves a fisherman worried for the future of his family when Burnett is forced to amputate his hand. Weatherill treats a woman admitted with pneumonia who is deeply concerned about her father's presence around her daughter. Ken bids a final farewell to the Royal, but Lizzie's resolve crumbles at the last minute. Michael Starke, Amy Robbins and Michelle Hardwick star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Eric Fogle is appointed as new head porter, putting Alun's nose out of joint. The hospital receives a letter of resignation from Dr Banner in Australia and has to appoint a partner to the practice - Weatherill believes she knows just the person, but Dr Ormerod favours Dr Burnett. Elsewhere, when Lucy Bayliss is involved in a horse-riding accident an X-ray reveals a more long-term problem. With Berwick Kaler and guest star Claire King

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Merton faces a race against time to stop a saboteur when Aidensfield hosts a prestigious car hill-climb. Meanwhile, Bernie finds an old car in a cowshed and decides to renovate it, giving Vernon his chance to scoop the winnings in the event. Rural police drama, starring Duncan Bell, Peter Benson and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A seemingly straightforward burglary investigation takes an unexpected turn when the victim is found to be leading a double life and suspicions are raised that the break-in could have been part of an insurance fraud. Blaketon falls for the charms of a solicitor and teams up with Ventress to help her track down the beneficiaries of an unusual bequest. Rural police drama, starring Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: The village is rife with gossip as news of the tiny arrival spreads. Charity finally agrees to a paternity test, while Zoe throws herself into work

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Zoe faces the fact that she has been duped by the Kings, Charity names her baby Noah, and Steph's management style soon brings the factory to a halt

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Vera hits the roof when Gail tells her that she and Jack have lost everything. Kevin and Sally despair as Rosie goes missing after being grounded

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: David takes revenge on Vera for upsetting his mum over the finances fiasco, Kevin and Sally put Rosie under 24-hour surveillance and Kirk devises a plan to help Les prove his worth

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A confrontation between hunt stewards and saboteurs leads to the suspicious death of a protester - and makes Jack wonder whether the thrill of the chase has given the horsey set a taste for human blood. Whodunit, starring David Jason as DI Frost, with Bruce Alexander, Sean Pertwee, Del Henney and Tat Whalley

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A girl disappears, prompting the police to begin a desperate search, convinced her errant father has snatched her. Blaketon decides to lend his expertise to the case - only to end up fighting for his life. Meanwhile, Crane and Bellamy's dedication to duty sees them placing their lives on the line to rescue the youngster - but tragedy strikes. James Carlton, Mark Jordon and Derek Fowlds star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A new recruit reports for his first day of work at the police station, but given his family's history in Aidensfield, not all of the villagers are pleased to see him. Meanwhile, Ben and Liz's fund-raising efforts appear to have rubbed off on Vernon, who begins to show his charitable side

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A body is discovered on the Northumberland moors, and identified as a woman who made a distressed 999 call on the night of her death - suggesting she may have been abducted by someone she knew. Vera takes on the case, and discovers the victim was a controversial figure in her home town, who had a complicated relationship with her family and a number of well-hidden secrets

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Ronnie and Sam are given 10 hours to find a hostage who was taken by two armed men, following a bungled robbery in which an innocent 'have-a-go-hero' was shot dead. When one of the accused is seized, the team is offered a deal - he will tell them the location of the captive in return for immunity from prosecution. Tamzin Outhwaite guest stars as uncompromising lawyer Miriam Pescatore

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective applies his professional know-how to a fatal shooting, and soon begins to suspect that the dead man's brother-in-law may know more about the case than he is letting on - a theory borne out by forensic tests on the murder weapon. Jack Shepherd stars as the dour detective, with Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: An accident at the harbour leaves a fisherman worried for the future of his family when Burnett is forced to amputate his hand. programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: The hospital staff are pushed to their limits when an amusement arcade collapses. In the search for survivors, a child is found with a suspected blood-clotting disorder and the team must find his mother to obtain his medical history. Stella enters the wreckage to free a girl who is trapped under a fruit machine, but when she becomes blocked in, Frankie tries to save her - and declares his feelings in the process. Medical drama, starring Natalie Anderson and Scott Taylor

programme.desc: The Kings offer to take Zoe's redundant fleet of refuse trucks off her hands, while Scott makes his feelings perfectly plain, and Marlon seems to have lost his touch in the kitchen

programme.desc: Scott offers Dawn a job, prompting an almighty row with Terry, and Jack's solution to Andy's problems does not go down well with Katie

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: David's actions cause Vera to have a serious think about the way she has been treating Gail, and Jason's exciting news goes down like a lead balloon

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Audrey offers to pay off Gail's mortgage, while Jack and Vera win a dream house

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Gruff detective Jack Frost's plans for a quiet weekend are disrupted by the gruesome discovery of an unidentified body floating in the river. However, soon after he has begun the investigation, he is forced to apply his deductive skills to a separate case involving an act of violence during a football match which left a player in a coma. Crime drama, starring David Jason, Larry Lamb, Bruce Alexander, Lindy Whiteford and Berwick Kaler

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The residents of Aidensfield are terrorised by a blackmailer and Sergeant Merton is less than impressed by the investigative methods of the handsome newcomer PC Rob Walker. Meanwhile, Vernon embarks on a venture in the prestigious world of publishing, with the help of David and Bernie. Jonathan Kerrigan stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An audacious thief steals the Aidensfield force's panda car and carries out a series of brazen robberies disguised as a police officer, culminating in a serious break-in at a jeweller's shop. Meanwhile, Vernon persuades Lord Ashfordly to host an exclusive painting weekend and offers his expertise to the amateur artists

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the discovery of a young man's body in an area notorious for illicit teenage gatherings, the corpse wrapped in plastic sheeting and having received a blow to the head. Vera follows the trail to a funfair where the victim used to work and a church where he sought refuge, having recently been made homeless. She delves into his family history to discover why he was on the streets when his parents lived nearby, while forensic evidence implicates the son of the vicar, who has a criminal past

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks is forced to reopen a 14-year-old case when a dying crack addict confesses to the murder of teenager Amanda Bennet, a crime for which her father Simon (guest star Tim McInnerny) was originally convicted. Brooks becomes torn between the belief of his former partner Bernie Rawlins and mounting doubts over the ability of current colleague Casey, and the case unearths the possibility that more ghosts from his drinking days will come back to haunt him. Starring Bradley Walsh and Paul Nicholls

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Two grieving widows lay rival claims to a corpse found washed up on the beach, each insisting it is the body of her missing husband. While it is obvious only one can be telling the truth, the detective finds it tricky to discern which of the women is lying - and why. Drama, guest starring Eleanor Bron, with Jack Shepherd

programme.desc: As the staff come to terms with the recent tragic events, new ambulance driver Bobby makes a dramatic entrance. Guest starring former Coronation Street star Sean Wilson

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Burnett is called out to a dilapidated farmhouse, where a teenager is running a high fever and his family seems to be struggling to cope. As the staff try to diagnose the youngster's illness, his pregnant mother is rushed to the hospital with the same symptoms and is left fighting for her life. Meanwhile, Ormerod and Rose attend to Sir Edward Fawcett, an eccentric explorer who wants to hike around Mexico, despite having a condition that means his days of adventure are over. Medical drama, guest starring Brian Blessed and Phyllis Logan

programme.title: Sport Filler Shows (2020)
programme.desc: A look back at a selection of sports covered by ITV, including horse racing, Formula One and darts

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur dabbles in the world of nouvelle cuisine, taking bookings on banquets. However, his chef goes on the run from a group of gangsters leaving him in the lurch when catering for a policeman's retirement party. Vintage comedy drama, starring George Cole and Gary Webster

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A crook arranges the conversion of replica firearms into the real thing and sells them on to small-time hoodlums. When one of the arms misfires killing both a policeman and its holder, Regan is intent on discovering the source before more innocent lives are lost. Crime drama, starring John Thaw and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Giant Lobster Hunters
programme.desc: The hunt for red gold heats up and the lobstermen are forced to put everything on the line to stop their businesses from going under. Rookie skipper Bryce needs to catch at least 100kg, while Cracker discovers that his secret fishing spot has been invaded by other boats

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: The Sheriff of Nottingham tries to avoid paying his debts to a Jewish moneylender by inciting a riot. Fantasy drama, starring Michael Praed

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Panama v France (Kick-off 11.00am). All the action from both teams' final match in Group F, held at Sydney Football Stadium in Australia. Panama qualified for this tournament for the first time and the odds are stacked against them as they face the 2019 quarter-finalists. Seema Jaswal presents, with analysis from Vicky Losada, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Lucy Ward

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes at British brands. Narrated by Jimmy Nail

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: The secrets of an unskippable vinyl turntable from a team of audio-loving experts and the community spirit that goes into creating a classic elderflower cordial. Plus, the company making some of the planet's best telescopes, the team of master craftsmen who make models of some of the world's most loved locomotives

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: Part one of two. Thomas agrees to protect an insecure, emotionally scarred society woman who was kidnapped as a child and now believes someone is trying to kill her. Meanwhile, Higgins announces he is going to marry a childhood sweetheart. Detective drama, guest starring Sharon Stone

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A frustrated housewife supplies Regan with the names of the gang who recently ransacked a bookmakers - including that of her husband, a notorious robber. However, he has a cast-iron alibi, so proving his guilt proves harder than anticipated. Crime drama, starring John Thaw and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Boxer Lewis Nelson hires Ray to keep his gambling-addicted wife away from the casino he partly owns. However, she persuades Arthur to play the roulette wheels on her behalf, tempting him with the 'winning system' she has devised. Comedy starring George Cole

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: How a biochemist-turned-distiller is making Britain's first commercially produced rum, and what it takes to make a George Cross - Britain's highest civilian award for bravery. Plus, the man who is going back to nature thanks to his handmade wooden canoes, and the Sheffield firm making the tools of the trade for the world finest furniture makers

programme.title: Karen Carney's Leaders of the Pack
programme.desc: Karen meets the five-time African Women's Footballer of the Year Asisat Oshoala, who has given girls the chance to chase their dreams through her foundation in Lagos, Nigeria

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: A report from Southeast Asia, of something in the water that's sliced cleanly through a young man's testicles, is enough to lure 'fishing detective' Jeremy Wade to the shores of the Mekong - a river long renowned for its monstrous fish. But what kind of creature could have inflicted such a distinctive, surgical wound? In his quest to expose the unseen mutilator, Jeremy uncovers multiple victims who've been mauled, half-blinded, and even fatally wounded by the same mysterious assailant - a baby-faced killer that appears to be proliferating

programme.title: Monster Carp
programme.desc: Neil and Tom head off to the Lac du Der Chantecoq in France in search of the biggest wild carp in the world that was last caught at 103 pounds

programme.title: Rocky V (1990)
programme.desc: The heavyweight champion is forced into retirement due to brain damage inflicted in the ring, and finds his fortune has been lost on the stock market by his accountant. Returning to his working-class roots, he trains an up-and-coming fighter, only to see his protege turn against him. Drama sequel, starring Sylvester Stallone, Talia Shire and real-life boxer Tommy Morrison

programme.desc: A report from Southeast Asia, of something in the water that's sliced cleanly through a young man's testicles, is enough to lure 'fishing detective' Jeremy Wade to the shores of the Mekong - a river long renowned for its monstrous fish. But what kind of creature could have inflicted such a distinctive, surgical wound? In his quest to expose the unseen mutilator, Jeremy uncovers multiple victims who've been mauled, half-blinded, and even fatally wounded by the same mysterious assailant - a baby-faced killer that appears to be proliferating

Drama sequel, starring Sylvester Stallone, Talia Shire and real-life boxer Tommy Morrison

From a tomato cultivation machine to a huge pot of tomato soup, there is lots of strange stuff at Pobi's place, and when Tata and Kuma learn that Pobi has lived for 1000 years just like the witch from the book, they are suddenly gripped with fear and worry about the purpose of Pobi's invitation.

programme.title: Kew Gardens: A Year in Bloom
programme.desc: Winter leads to a carpet of snowdrops bringing in the visitors, and in the Rock Garden, Faye talks about the world of galanthophiles, the official name for snowdrop obsessives. In the warmth of Kew's glasshouses, Alberto prepares for his first orchid festival in charge, but luckily, he has help in veteran volunteer Henck. He and Alberto have set themselves the tricky task of creating a giant orchid sun in the middle of a pond

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Susan Calman's Grand Week by the Sea
programme.desc: In Bournemouth, Susan takes a ride on the land train along the seven-mile stretch of sandy beach. She then heads to the lower gardens joining other holidaymakers to listen to the band playing in the historic Pine Walk Bandstand. Along the coast, she boards the ferry to Mudeford which boasts some of the best beach huts in the region. She also meets Gareth Malone for a game of Jenga

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: John collects an old debt and calls in a favour, while Kayce considers his options for the future as the Duttons realise the potential repercussions of the dispute as the dust settles from the shootout. Drama, starring Kevin Costner, Luke Grimes and Kelly Reilly

programme.title: Britain's Favourite 80s Songs
programme.desc: Jackie Brambles narrates this look back at 1989, the era of Madonna, Milli Vanilli and Jason Donovan. Toyah Willcox, Paul Gambaccini, Cheryl Baker and Jenny Powell add their thoughts on the year when the Bangles' Eternal Flame was a huge hit, Lisa Stansfield sang All Around The World, and Jive Bunny and the Mastermixers were almost unstoppable

programme.title: Bee Gees: One For All Tour - Live In Australia
programme.desc: Recorded live in Melbourne in '89, Barry, Maurice and Robin Gibb perform songs from their career, from their 1960s breakthrough to classic 1970s and 1980s hits, and tracks from the album One

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Great British Ships
programme.desc: The Mayflower transported the first English Puritans from Plymouth to the New World in 1620. The Pilgrims and the ship's crew overcame almost impossible odds to establish a colony, which ultimately gave birth to the United States of America. Taking to the waters off the New England coast, Rob Bell recounts the dramatic story of the Mayflower's 66-day crossing, as she endured high seas and monstrous storms. In Mystic,Connecticut, Rob explores a full-sized replica of the Mayflower and in Plymouth, Massachusetts, unfolds the story of the ship's arrival in the New World

programme.title: Michael Palin in North Korea
programme.desc: The comedy actor presents the first of two programmes documenting life for many of the millions who live, work and have families in North Korea. Michael's arrival coincides with the historic meeting between North Korean leader Kim Jong-Un and South Korean president Moon Jae-In, as he embarks on a journey of some 1,300 miles of the reclusive nation south to north visiting sites and locations rarely, if ever, explored by Westerners, determined to spend time with everyday Korean citizens from all walks of life

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: The pups investigate ghostly goings-on in Barkingburg after the Princess sees a suit of armour move and thinks that the castle is haunted

programme.title: Tooth Fairy (2010)
programme.desc: A minor-league ice hockey player is nicknamed the Tooth Fairy for knocking opponents' teeth out on the ice. When the cynical athlete discourages a young fan, he is forced to pay penance by spending a week as the real Tooth Fairy, rediscovering his dreams in the process. Family comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Ashley Judd, Stephen Merchant, Ryan Sheckler and Seth MacFarlane

programme.title: Rango (2011)
programme.desc: A pet chameleon with an active imagination ends up lost in the desert. He makes his way to a lawless town of animals, where he is mistaken for a deadly gunslinger and made sheriff. He organises the townsfolk into a posse when bandits led by an evil rattlesnake steal their supply of water. Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy

programme.title: Carry On Constable (1960)
programme.desc: A flu epidemic leaves a police station short of staff, forcing a desperate inspector to send four bungling trainees on the beat. The inept would-be bobbies manage to increase the crime rate even before they have started work, and their long-suffering sergeant faces an uphill battle to whip them into shape. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Kenneth Connor, Charles Hawtrey and Joan Sims

programme.title: The Desert Rats (1953)
programme.desc: A Scottish army officer is placed in command of a unit of Australian troops given the task of defending Tobruk against overwhelming German forces, led by the renowned general Rommel. Second World War adventure, starring Richard Burton, Robert Newton and James Mason, reprising his role as Rommel from The Desert Fox

programme.title: The Mountain Between Us (2017)
programme.desc: An English neurosurgeon desperate to attend an operation crosses paths with an American bride-to-be determined to get to her wedding. When their chartered flight crashes, they attempt to survive in the wilderness, while fighting their attraction to each other. Romantic adventure, starring Idris Elba, Kate Winslet and Beau Bridges

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood (2019)
programme.desc: Faded television actor Rick Dalton and his stunt double Cliff Booth strive to hang on to their careers during the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles. As they navigate a changing film industry they barely recognise any more, they are drawn into the orbit of both ill-fated rising star Sharon Tate, and Charles Manson and his cult of zealous followers. Drama from director Quentin Tarantino, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt, Margot Robbie, Timothy Olyphant and Al Pacino

programme.title: The Death of Dick Long (2019)
programme.desc: Three friends gather for what is supposed to be a band practice, but when one of them is badly hurt while they are messing around, it falls to his gormless mates to help him - with disastrous results. Comedy directed by and starring Daniel Scheinert (co-helmer of Oscar-winner Everything Everywhere All at Once), with Michael Abbott Jnr and Andre Hyland

programme.title: Like a Boss (2020)
programme.desc: Friends Mia and Mel run their own beauty company. However, things take a turn for the worse when their business runs into a massive amount of debt. They are forced to turn to ruthless benefactor Claire Luna, head of a major cosmetics empire, who intends to steal the business from under them. Comedy, starring Tiffany Haddish, Rose Byrne and Salma Hayek

programme.title: Rugrats in Paris (2000)
programme.desc: The lucky little tots embark on a trip to a French theme park - but while the rest of the gang are intent on enjoying themselves, Chuckie is distracted by his wish for a new mum. He sets his sights on the owner of the amusement park as a prospective partner for his single dad. Animated adventure, with the voices of Christine Cavanaugh, Elizabeth Daily, Cheryl Chase, Kath Soucie and Susan Sarandon

programme.title: Cutthroat Island (1995)
programme.desc: A tough female pirate enlists the help of an educated slave in finding the three parts of a map leading to buried treasure. However, one of the pieces is in the hands of her cruel uncle, and she also has to find the loot before her crew mutinies or the British Navy catches up with her. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Geena Davis, Matthew Modine, Frank Langella and Maury Chaykin

programme.title: Gunfight at the OK Corral (1957)
programme.desc: US Marshal Wyatt Earp lays down his badge to live a peaceful life with his brothers in the town of Tombstone. As a feud erupts with the ruthless Clanton gang, he forms an unlikely alliance with hard-drinking gambler Doc Holliday to face them in a historic showdown. Western, starring Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas, Dennis Hopper, Lee Van Cleef and DeForest Kelley

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton (1957)
programme.desc: Lord Loam is proud of his tendency to treat his staff as equals - to a point - while his manservant Crichton believes people should know their place. However, when the entire household is shipwrecked on a desert island, it is the resourceful butler who rises to the top of the pecking order - to the horror of his supposedly liberal master. Comedy based on JM Barrie's play, starring Kenneth More, Cecil Parker, Diane Cilento and Peter Graves

programme.title: Skyscraper (2018)
programme.desc: A former hostage negotiator takes a job as a security expert at the world's tallest building in Hong Kong. He finds himself framed for sabotage when the skyscraper bursts into flames. As he strives to clear his name, he must also fight his way back into the blazing tower to rescue his family, who are being held hostage by criminals 225 storeys up. Action thriller, starring Dwayne Johnson, Neve Campbell and Chin Han

programme.title: Good Boys (2019)
programme.desc: Three lads skip school and embark on an epic journey while carrying stolen drugs. They are hunted by teenage girls, and attempt to make their way home in time for a long-awaited party. Director Gene Stupnitsky's comedy, starring Jacob Tremblay, Keith L Williams and Brady Noon

programme.title: Mean Girls (2004)
programme.desc: A teenager is surprised when she is befriended by the girls in the most popular clique at her new school. However, a dating mishap leads to trouble and her supposed friends start to turn on her. Urged on by other pals outside their circle, the newcomer resolves to bring down the self-appointed queen of campus - only to end up adopting some of her rival's crueller characteristics. Comedy, with Lindsay Lohan, Rachel McAdams, Tina Fey and Lacey Chabert

programme.title: The Handmaiden (2016)
programme.desc: A conman posing as a count hires a petty criminal to help him marry a Japanese heiress by becoming her handmaiden and persuading her to accept his proposal. Psychological thriller based on Sarah Waters' bestselling novel Fingersmith, starring Kim Min-hee, Kim Tae-ri, Ha Jung-woo and Cho Jin-woong. In Korean and English

programme.title: Monsters vs Aliens (2009)
programme.desc: A woman is exposed to radiation from a meteorite that causes her to grow to an enormous size during her wedding. She is captured by the military and held prisoner with an assortment of strange creatures - but when aliens invade, these freaks of nature are the only ones capable of saving the world. Animated sci-fi comedy, with the voices of Reese Witherspoon and Hugh Laurie

programme.title: The Spiderwick Chronicles (2008)
programme.desc: Life for identical twins Jared and Simon and their sister Mallory begins afresh when their mother inherits a spooky mansion. But after moving in, strange things begin to happen, and as the youngsters investigate, they discover a book that opens up a mysterious world of amazing supernatural creatures. Fantasy adventure, starring Freddie Highmore in a dual role alongside Sarah Bolger and Nick Nolte

programme.title: The Ghost and Mrs Muir (1947)
programme.desc: A lonely widow moves into a seaside cottage, despite rumours that it is haunted. Sure enough, she finds herself sharing her home with the spirit of a dead sea captain - but his efforts to scare her away prove unsuccessful, and instead a growing attraction develops between the pair as she agrees to write his biography. Romantic fantasy, starring Gene Tierney, Rex Harrison and George Sanders

programme.title: Mysterious Island (1961)
programme.desc: Soldiers escaping the American Civil War take flight in a giant observation balloon and land far away on a strange uncharted island, where they encounter giant creatures, cut-throat pirates, two shipwrecked Englishwomen - and the mysterious Captain Nemo. Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Michael Craig, Herbert Lom, Joan Greenwood and Michael Callan, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Congo (1995)
programme.desc: An expedition to find King Solomon's diamond mines in the jungles of the Congo disappears without trace. The tycoon behind the mission sends his assistant, a former CIA agent, to find out what became of the explorers - only to discover that the party met a grisly fate at the hands of a horde of vicious apes. Action adventure based on Michael Crichton's novel, with Dylan Walsh, Laura Linney, Tim Curry and Grant Heslov

programme.title: Predator (1987)
programme.desc: An elite military team takes on a top-secret mission in the jungles of Central America, but the soldiers realise they have been deceived by their CIA employers. A greater danger presents itself when they are stalked by a lethal alien big-game hunter with the power to become invisible, that has come to Earth to stalk human prey. Sci-fi thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Carl Weathers and Bill Duke

programme.title: Crawl (2019)
programme.desc: When her Florida home town is devastated by a hurricane, Haley heads back into danger to search for her missing father. The pair find themselves trapped in a rapidly flooding house, but the rising waters might be the least of their worries. Horror thriller, starring Kaya Scodelario and Barry Pepper

programme.title: Animal Kingdom (2010)
programme.desc: A teenager goes to live with his grandmother after his mother's death from a drug overdose, only to find his new guardian is the head of a criminal gang. He must decide where his loyalties lie when his unstable uncle leads the family into increasingly violent actions, while a police detective tries to persuade him to turn informant.
