Hailing from Manchester, Josh was a class act with the lads at his all-boys school but always failed when it came to chatting up women. He hopes that the Naked Attraction experience can find him the perfect partner. Next is 28-year-old performer Jack from London. As a gay divorcee, Jack's love life has definitely hit some low notes, but he's decided now it's on with the show

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson welcomes a pansexual Twitch streamer from Manchester hoping to make a connection outside of the virtual world and a bondage enthusiast from Shropshire looking for a silver fox who will share her distinctive tastes in the bedroom

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The pranksters reveal more favourite moments from the show, talk about some of the most surprising reactions they have had, and introduce previously unseen footage

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The jokers work in a dentist's office and a film theatre's concession stand, and participate in an unusual photography shoot for their blogs

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share more of their insightful critiques of the week's biggest and best shows, including The Great British Bake Off, The World According to Vladimir Putin, Take Me Out, Seven Worlds, One Planet, This Morning and movie The Revenant. Narrated by Craig Cash. First shown in November 2019

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy tries to help Sheldon get over his desire for closure when one of his favourite TV shows is cancelled on a cliffhanger ending. Raj discovers his new girlfriend Lucy has a blog in which she has written about him, and is upset when he learns she believes he has feminine qualities, causing him to worry about their relationship

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon discover their favourite childhood TV science show host Professor Proton can be booked for private parties and decide to hire him to entertain them. Meanwhile, Raj asks Howard and Bernadette to look after his dog for the weekend, but the couple panic when the canine goes missing. Guest starring Bob Newhart

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta tries to set a new record on a training course, Diaz does not receive an invitation to Boyle's wedding, and Holt becomes addicted to a game application on his smartphone. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Boyle asks Peralta to be his best man, but as well as helping out with cake-tasting and choosing invitations, he must also persuade the groom to start standing up to Vivian before the big day. Holt helps Diaz make a sincere apology and Jeffords, Santiago and Gina embark on a tough new diet - but struggle to stick to it

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When Tina struggles to keep up with her job at Calvin's garage due to her burgeoning baking business, he faces a tough decision

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin splurges on an expensive jacket, then worries it's too special to risk wearing outside the house. Dave and Gemma worry their new friends' daughter is a bad influence

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp visits Manhattan, where she creates candy canes and lollipops at artisan sugar crafter Papabubble, before heading back to the UK to learn how to make passion fruit marshmallows covered in chocolate and coconut

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman goes house hunting with Mandy and Paul from Sussex around the picturesque Spanish town of Dolores. They're dreaming of a permanent move to their favourite part of the Costa Blanca with their six cats and rescue dog and would love to find a house with plenty of outside space for their furry family. Jasmine manages to find five properties within their maximum budget of 185,000, but whether any of them will be liked by her clients remains to be seen

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Road Trip
programme.desc: A trip around the coast of Majorca in a sailing boat, and the family who are attempting to launch a restaurant on the north of the island. Narrated by Fred Sirieix

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Wokingham in Berkshire to meet professional gardener Mark whose barns are brimful of bikes, bric-a-brac and baggage

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien are in Windsor, Berkshire, to meet Roy, whose garages are stacked full of bikes. Henry picks the one that doesn't work to take away, while Simon converts some 17th-century wooden beams into a pair of stylish bedside lamps

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The researchers look for beneficiaries to the 750,000 estate of an Oxfordshire man who died in 2011, and try to find out if a Salford man who they have been tracing relatives for owned his own property. Plus, details of unclaimed estates with heirs still waiting to be found

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives visit a stately home in Warwickshire as they try to find relatives of a lady who was born there, and an heir on another case embarks on a journey of discovery to learn about the grandfather he never met. Plus, details of unclaimed estates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: A quartet of B&B owners battle it out to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money, beginning with luxury weight-loss and detox retreat Slimmeria in East Sussex. The guests worry about uncomfortable sleeping arrangements, the price of accommodation and the strict 9pm curfew - and the prospect of a dance-style workout only exacerbates their bad mood

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jan and William Cheeseman, owners of five-star Gold-rated 38 St Giles in Norwich, try to impress their competitors. Unfortunately, poor breakfast presentation and complaints about noise from the street increase the tension between the couple as they strive for perfection

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Ann and Bill Clay play host at their four-star Bosvean House B&B in Bude, Cornwall. Diane and Max Seivewright query the establishment's luxury description, while Galia Grainger complains about the lack of a sea view. However, the hosts hope an indulgent Cornish cream tea, a stick dance and a drink in their garden shed will succeed in winning over the guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Village bakers Diane and Max Seivewright, the owners of Ombersley B&B in Worcestershire, host the last round of the competition, but some guests are far from impressed with the rooms and food

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners gather to find out who has won the competition. Diane and Max Seivewright, the hosts at Ombersley B&B, feel betrayed by Ann and Bill Clay's feedback and want to know why they have been so harshly criticised, while Galia Grainger asks why Slimmeria's rules and regulations have provoked so much hostility

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the secret life of the animals of Chester Zoo, one of Britain's most popular zoos, using new micro-rig technology to capture the behaviour of the animals and their close relationships with their keepers. Vets at Chester Zoo treat an elephant calf for the herpes virus, the same virus that resulted in the deaths of two calves the year before. A breeding phenomenon plays out among the extraordinary cardinal fish, and the zoo's humboldt penguins welcome 16 new members to their colony

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Sammy the retriever is acting mopey as yet another of his buddies finds a new home. However, when Max appears, it might just be that he has found his new best friend. Margot the collie needs an owner who will ensure that her active mind stays busy, while hiker Katherine wants a dog that can keep up with her. It may just be that they are the perfect match - so long as Margot's nerves don't get the better of her. After 200 days at Woodgreen, Brooke the German shepherd is still struggling to find a home. Is there a happy ending around the corner?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Cumbrian couple Rob and Ruth, who have bought a 200-year-old former blacking mill and plan to slot in an entirely new, timber-clad structure within its walls, giving the impression that it is peeping out from the original ruins. But the original building is a scheduled monument and Historic England inform them it is too dangerous to repair, giving them no choice but to painstakingly rebuild the ancient mill around their new structure

programme.title: Secret History
programme.desc: Cameras follow the multimillion-dollar expedition that discovered the Victorian ship HMS Erebus, intact and upright on the Arctic sea floor in September 2014. The story unfolds in the freezing Arctic, where search vessels battled with heavy sea-ice that threatened to stop the search entirely, to the dramatic chain of events that led to the historic discovery

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The latest batch of patients to be treated in the A&E department of London's King's College Hospital includes two with serious head injuries, including a cyclist from Brighton who has been airlifted to the building. Also brought in by helicopter is a father-of-four who fell from scaffolding as he repaired a roof, while other cases include former docker Bill, who has hurt his knee while drinking at his local working men's club

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The stories of children and teenagers brought into A&E. Sixteen-year-old Ellie has suspected spinal injuries after being thrown from her horse and crushed against a fence, while consultant Jacqui Butler treats four-year-old Destiny, who has a fishbone stuck in his tonsils from his lunchtime curry. Plus, a pregnant woman experiences intense pain following a sudden haemorrhage

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In Oxfordshire, cyclist Matt suffers life-threatening injuries after a collision with a car. On the A1, 64-year-old John is trapped in his car after a head-on collision. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, heli-medics fly to one of the most remote roads in Britain to help Caroline who has come off a motorbike and is injured

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Major trauma cases dealt with by West Midlands Ambulance Service paramedics, including a woman who has just given birth to a baby who is not breathing, and a bike ride in a park that has ended with an open fracture of the ankle

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The latest batch of patients to be treated in the A&E department of London's King's College Hospital includes two with serious head injuries, including a cyclist from Brighton who has been airlifted to the building. Also brought in by helicopter is a father-of-four who fell from scaffolding as he repaired a roof, while other cases include former docker Bill, who has hurt his knee while drinking at his local working men's club

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt visits Argentina to learn the secret of perfect popcorn, Andi Oliver looks at how the mould gets put inside blue cheese, and Jimmy Doherty is in Germany to see how electricity is used in cutting-edge crisp production

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp teams up with potter Richard Miller to help Ellie and Nick Harrington - who have no practical DIY skills - create plates to complement their 1930s-style dining room in Tunbridge Wells, Kent

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sarah and Adam from Sussex have been dreaming of buying in Spain for several years. They're looking for a holiday home in the beautiful coastal town of Mojacar, which one day they might move into permanently. However, they've never been to the area before, so ask expert Jean Johansson for help. With a budget of 85,000 Jean lines up five options, but will any of them prove to be perfect?

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Road Trip
programme.desc: In the Midi-Pyrnes region of south-west France, two young families from the Midlands set up a cycling business, a London couple run a glamping ground and an ex-army major and his wife deal with a big renovation project. Narrated by Fred Sirieix

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Max McMurdo head to Herefordshire to meet George, who has been collecting for more than 70 years. Max finds a crate of vintage motor oil bottles that he thinks could be worth a small fortune

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In the picturesque Devon countryside, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet Derek and Daphne, who have decades of collecting stored in multiple barns. Henry finds a very rare tractor, which he has never found in a shed search before, while a Raleigh Shopper bike really lights Simon's fire

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives receive a case from America with a strong showbusiness connection, and must trace the relatives of a woman who left the UK as a child in 1936. Plus, the story of a man adopted as a boy leads to an exotic tale of life on the island of Bermuda

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The race is on to find heirs to the 100,000 estate of a woman from Southsea, and the search uncovers the romantic story of a husband and wife who met while serving in the Navy. Plus, an heir seeks to learn more about her aunts and uncles and makes a poignant discovery about her mother's twin brother. The programme also provides details of other unclaimed estates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Former pop singer Danny Karne welcomes guests to the Pavilion, his fashion and rock 'n' roll-themed hotel in central London, and the sports car parked outside wows his visitors. But the petrol-head's decision to take his fellow hoteliers to a motoring museum goes down badly when one of them reveals he has no passion for cars

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: John Luce and his partner Pat Sutton invite their fellow hoteliers to the Fox and Duck, a country inn in Therfield, Hertfordshire. The local golf club provides the guests with adequate entertainment, and they appear to bond as they share friendly banter and a spot of singing at the end of the night. However, the following morning brings with it a shower disaster

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dave and Debbie Lang, who run the New Inn in Newbridge-on-Wye, Powys, play host. Dave is a keen pig breeder and owns the on-site butcher's shop as well as running a pub, so he serves some of his award-winning pork products for breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Kerstin and Robert Sharpe, the owners of Westleigh Farm in Somerset, play host, and despite the initial cobwebs found by some of the guests, they are soon won over by the size of the showers, the quality of the milk and the generous helpings for breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: The Rothschild's giraffes are expecting a new addition as 12-year-old matriarch Dagmar, whose last calf died after a few days, goes into labour after a 15-month pregnancy. Orang-utan sisters Tuti and Siska, and their baby cousin Kesuma, rebuild their relationship after the trauma of the fire that engulfed their habitat in December 2018, while the keepers set off in pursuit when a blue-throated macaw goes on the run

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Lily and her family meet a pug at Animal Welfare League NSW dog sanctuary, while Paul and Diana strike gold with a mini-Aussie shepherd

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits a home built on an airfield in Strathaven in Scotland to check on the progress made by Colin MacKinnon and his partner Marta Briongos. Their ambitious plan was to build a metal-sculptural home inspired by aircraft hangars right next to the runway, but the difficulties of building their elegant design saw a year-long project stretch to three years

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: Alan and Val McCoy put their life savings on the line to make their dream of living on water come true, entrusting a boat builder to make them their dream narrow boat floating home. The couple have been together for 11 years and now that they're retired, they've decided that owning a narrow boat could be a unique way to be near their families - all of whom live along the canal system across the Midlands and north-west England

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Couple Fiona and Sal, who want very different things, try to reach a compromise, so Sal picks the location - in Torquay, Victoria - and Fiona gets to decide the design

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc: Alice Levine continues to explore the sex lives of others, discovering out-of-the-ordinary love stories from across the world. In this first episode, she dives into new, advanced technologies that could be what sex and relationships will look like in the future, meeting a couple in Berlin who opened the world's first cyber-brothel, populated by talking sex dolls. She heads to Las Vegas to witness the next generation of sex-robots and also meets a couple whose relationship exists in a virtual 'furry' universe, but who are about to risk it all, taking their love affair offline and moving across the world to be together IRL (In Real Life)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A builder falls at work and dislocates his shoulder in such an unusual way it takes a five-strong team to pull it into place. Alan, who is in his sixties and had one leg amputated in 2009, comes in with the other dangerously swollen following a holiday in Goa, and 83-year-old James has to be persuaded by senior sister AnnMarie to accept treatment for a cyst on his knee

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Major road traffic collisions that paramedics have been faced with, including a quad biker who has collided with the windscreen of a car on a residential street in Birmingham

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc: Alice Levine continues to explore the sex lives of others, discovering out-of-the-ordinary love stories from across the world. In this first episode, she dives into new, advanced technologies that could be what sex and relationships will look like in the future, meeting a couple in Berlin who opened the world's first cyber-brothel, populated by talking sex dolls. She heads to Las Vegas to witness the next generation of sex-robots and also meets a couple whose relationship exists in a virtual 'furry' universe, but who are about to risk it all, taking their love affair offline and moving across the world to be together IRL (In Real Life)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt travels Uruguay to solve a mystery surrounding corned beef, and Briony Williams heads to Ireland to discover the difference between Scottish whisky and Irish whiskey. Plus, Dr Helen Lawal finds out the tricks snack manufacturers use to keep customers wanting more

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is taught how to bind books by expert Isabelle Ting, and reveals how to create a notebook from leftover materials including leather offcuts, recycled leather coats and decorative paper

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Army reserve nurse Denise from Wigan and her friend Karen enlist the help of Jonnie Irwin to find Denise's perfect holiday home in and around Guardamar del Segura on the Spanish Costa Blanca. Jonnie shows the pair five properties for the budget of 95,000, hoping at least one will be to their liking

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Road Trip
programme.desc: Cameras visit the Costa del Sol, meeting a chef from Scotland with a keen eye for fresh Mediterranean seafood, two sea lovers running a boat charter business and a former journalist from London on the hunt for local underwater treasures. Narrated by Fred Sirieix

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Max McMurdo head to Worcestershire where Max transforms old air tanks into a sports car, while Simon makes a trendy bar bench out of old barrels

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to the north of Wales where they meet Sue, who is clearing out her late husband's antique shop stock. Henry manages to find a pedal car, while Simon takes a toy yacht

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives search for the relatives of a popular Manchester man who has left behind a 20,000 estate, but have their work cut out when they discover part of his family emigrated to the other side of the world. Plus, a newly advertised unclaimed property causes problems for the team

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives are called in by a solicitor to help track down the beneficiaries to a 300,000 estate left by a former merchant seaman, and while looking for the relatives of an actress, they unearth the story of a couple who made front-page news when they eloped

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners of Guest and the City, Dan and Mardi Leonard, welcome their visitors in Brighton, but there is a mixed reaction to the couple's contemporary decor and stained glass windows. The unconventional furniture leaves some guests confused, and one pair of fellow hoteliers bemoan the lack of sausages at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Phil Kiernan invites the contestants to the Farmer's Boy Inn in Longhope, Gloucestershire, where he challenges them to a pie-making competition. However, the task proves less entertaining than the bickering that occurs between two guests as they try to share a kitchen

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Alan and Jane Asher host on the Geanna, their purpose-built hotel boat. Dan and Mardi Leonard are concerned space is too tight, while Sarah Langford and Jean-Pierre Kujawa worry about their privacy being invaded. A trip up the Thames allows the guests to sip champagne and get to know the ropes, but the mood at dinner is subdued, and when the owners cook their first breakfast on board they find themselves bickering

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sarah Langford and Jean-Pierre Kujawa, who have run the Sentry Mead B&B on the Isle of Wight for six years, play host in the last challenge of the week. The guests arrive with high expectations and after a few setbacks, the dinner and breakfast win everyone over

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: The keepers notice the Asian short-clawed otters begin to develop worrying bald patches and call in the vet. The flamingo chicks are being moved from the creche to the adult aviary, but two birds who have bonded face being split up as one of them is limping and has to stay behind. A pregnant antelope's aggressive behaviour is causing concern

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Lucy had a stroke four years ago at the age of 31 and she and her sisters think a dog will aid her recovery, so they meet Fox the chihuahua cross at Animal Welfare League NSW

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets architectural designer Dan and interior designer Nina, who want to build a sleek, unique family house. But the plot they have bought, near a beautiful estuary in West Sussex, is dominated by a swampy pond that they are unable to fill in. Instead, they plan to make it central to their design, turning the pond into a biodiverse waterscape, and then floating their house above it. It's a challenge for anyone - but to save money, Dan is doing it largely himself, despite his limited experience with new builds

programme.title: Disturbing Disappearances
programme.desc: Lisa Ferrer, an ambitious young exec at a pharmaceutical company, goes missing after experiencing complicated workplace conflict and mental health problems. Newly appointed judge Leo Etchegarray joins the police team for the search, albeit with the frustrated acquiescence of Commander Amar. In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old Josh is flown in with a possible penile fracture resulting from a canal barge accident, and while his parents make jokes to try to lighten the atmosphere, the injury could have serious repercussions for his future. A man with an injured finger following a night of clubbing contemplates his upcoming gender reassignment therapy, which will include taking hormones, while an 80-year-old with terminal cancer arrives after collapsing at her home

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 21-year-old woman on her first trip to London from Northern Ireland appears to be experiencing kidney failure, and medics fear she could be at risk of a cardiac arrest. A man in a critical condition after falling 20ft from a balcony is brought in by helicopter, and a 34-year-old who fell off her platform shoes while dancing is treated for a deep gash on her forehead

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the hybrid panel quiz show, putting a comedy spin on Channel 4's long-running words-and-numbers game. Guest team captain David Walliams joins forces with Jonathan Ross, while Jon Richardson teams up with Joe Lycett. Isy Suttie joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, and Rachel Riley takes care of the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.desc: The car customiser with countless star clients gets the chance to wrap an American vehicle when the owners of a Camaro give Yianni free reign on their motor

programme.desc: The owner of Billericay Town FC asks Yianni to cover his beloved Ferrari F12 in the team's colours

programme.title: Top Gear

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Meth is found inside a truck driver's speakers, a Mexican boy claiming US citizenship is questioned, and AC units containing drugs are intercepted.

programme.title: Outback Pilots
programme.desc: Documentary outlining the work of pilots who risk their lives every day flying through Australia's inhospitable Outback terrain

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo explores Piedmont, a northern region that borders France and Switzerland and sits at the foot of the Alps. It is known for sophisticated cuisine and wines such as barolo, but it is also home to a truffle festival in the town of Alba, where Gino meets a man whose job is to hunt for the delicacies with his trusty four-legged friend. Piedmont is at the heart of the Italian rice production and Gino tries his hand at rice harvesting and cooks a meal that celebrates the Po Valley area

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape

programme.desc: Vic and Bob, Theo Paphitis, Janet Street Porter, Stephen K Amos, Justin Moorhouse, Ellie Taylor and Phil Tufnell take part in Lewes. Sean Kelly hosts

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John Heussi and his team work on a high-performance BMW 330, the Interceptor, while a shortage of staff sees Dave manning the phones

programme.title: Schitt's Creek
programme.desc: Some of Moira's lawn signs begin to disappear, and David and Alexis work to get David's boss out of trouble. Comedy, starring Eugene Levy

programme.title: Live at the Apollo

The pair go on a guided tour in which they view masterpieces by Bosch, Velasquez, Picasso and Dali, before they attend a ham-carving workshop and a sample a five-course tasting menu, of which four courses are pork or ham, including a tartare dish. They also take in a lively boating lake, a circus church and a grisly tour of the Spanish Inquisition

programme.title: Becoming Elizabeth
programme.desc: Elizabeth's decision to side with one sibling has devastating consequences and leaves the Lord Protector Somerset trying to maintain the balance between the two opposing religions. As Catherine's sworn enemy is released from the Tower, Elizabeth is horrified by the chain reaction she has unwittingly begun

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Royal Hotel, in Clacton-on-Sea, Essex, where General Manager Vicki Hart and Events Manager Kara Cross hope to wow the guests with their boutique seafront hotel. Everyone laps up the luxury rooms, but in the evening, talk turns tense with accusations of foul play. In the morning, a noisy night and a dry shower cause troubles for Tina and Danielle. At breakfast, the sausages and bacon become a bone of contention for some guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Simran Samra hosts the first party in east London, and decides to cook meat for her main course, despite being a vegetarian. The fashionista tries to salvage her chances of winning the 1,000 prize by performing a range of comedy accents after fellow competitor Alan Price upsets one of the guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Comedian Yoshki Greenberg hosts the second dinner party in east London, but her decision to surprise the guests by asking them to wear animal-themed pyjama suits does not go down well - leaving her struggling to win them over with a stand-up routine

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alan Price hosts the third party in east London, and sets out to impress his fellow competitors with a medieval-themed dinner. He hopes to raise the standard of the contest with an ambitious menu, but stumbles at the first hurdle when vegetarian diner Simran Samra panics at the sight of his authentic pig's head as the table centrepiece. Things do not improve as the night goes on, with dirty dinner plates and sloppy hosting leaving the guests less than impressed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bar owner Delia Elliot hosts the fourth dinner party from east London, and she is confident she can teach her young diners the protocol of entertaining guests. However, prankster Alan Price ends up having an argument with her, leading Simran Samra to take evasive action

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Doctor Chintu Gademsetty hosts the final dinner party in east London, and is confident of impressing his guests with a 1980s-themed evening. Even though his dance competition is not a hit with all of the diners, his food goes down a treat, before the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: In France, the owners of a glampsite are ready for their next adventure, and there is a catch-up with a couple of B&B owners who were looking for the quiet life

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Grant and Francesca Crofton have a two-year-old son and would like to expand their family further. This means they need more space, but should this be in Leeds - where they live now - or Treviso in Italy, where Francesca comes from? Laura Hamilton and Jonnie Irwin help the couple weigh up their options

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Brian and Chantal have decided to sell their family home to fund their dreams of a house abroad. Jonnie Irwin helps them look for a smaller house in Cirencester where they already live, while Laura Hamilton takes them around properties in western France where they want to spend their retirement

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sisters Sophie and Charlotte Rodriguez help international basketball competitor Therese Traynor find a holiday home in Alicante province for her budget of 100,000 euros. Accompanying Therese are her twin children Tariq and Sara, who are keen to help fulfil their mother's 20-year dream of buying a place in Spain. In Almeria, husband-and-wife duo Steve and Sharon Garner help Glenn and Mary Peake from Worcestershire find their dream Spanish retirement retreat for a budget of 170,000 euros

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Training guru Steve Carlyle hosts the first party in York, but a sophisticated evening, complete with a butler, does nothing to boost his reputation as he competes to win the 1,000 prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trevor Rooney, who leads tours of supposedly haunted sites in York, hosts the second dinner party in the city at a bric-a-brac warehouse. He also has several spooky surprises in store for his guests, including a magic show, a paranormal-themed menu and a ventriloquist's doll that spends the evening flirting with the female diners

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third dinner party in York is hosted by Annie Albericci, who hopes to bring peace, love and harmony to the table with her festival-chic-themed evening. However, things go from bad to worse for Annie when the male guests find a racy photo of her

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nurse Yvonne McGill hosts the fourth dinner challenge in York and goes for a 1960s-themed party, including a game of Snog, Marry, Avoid? and a Beatles tribute band. Meanwhile, guest Steve reveals his celebrity crush

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Foodie Rebecca Ryan hosts the final dinner party in York, and hopes to impress her guests by throwing a Hollywood-themed evening of glitz and glamour, before the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps a couple find their dream holiday home in Benalmadena on the Spanish Costa del Sol. Samar and Pap have a budget of 220,000 and are looking for a place for their large extended family to stay on their vacations

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: In the first challenge, the remaining teams are tasked with creating 24 reimagined millefeuille and 24 pavlovas in never-before-seen ways. The showpiece display must feature two batches of 24 modern religieuse, designed to look like musical icons

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The architect tries to unlock the potential of old properties

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who has been stabbed in the leg and the head, only to discover he had already overdosed on heroin prior to receiving his injuries. Paramedics also treat a man struggling to breathe after a triple heart bypass operation, a woman whose rare genetic condition causes her to have seizures, and a man with severe chest pains who has recently had treatment for a heart complaint

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on The Great British Bake Off, Vigil, Changing Rooms, Sex Actually with Alice Levine, This Morning and Michel Roux's French Country Cooking. They also offer their opinions on the gas crisis and the relaxation of travel restrictions, as reported by the BBC and ITV

programme.title: Confessions of a Cam Girl
programme.desc: Part one of two. The stories of five women selling explicit videos online. The market has exploded since lockdown, leaving them struggling to find a niche among their competitors. Maya uses her earnings to support her family financially, but is feeling burned out by the pressure to produce as much content as possible, while Sarah has been invited to attend her first-ever photoshoot in Marbella

programme.title: Our Guy in Colombia
programme.desc: Part two of two. Guy Martin continues his tour of the country's secret side by trying his hand at a semi-illegal cycling sport, where the goal is to drop down the steepest mountain roads as quickly as possible on modified bikes, using extra weight to go faster. After climbing onboard a drug cartel's smuggler narco-submarine to see how it could be built in a jungle workshop, Guy gets face to face with a drug dealer and former employee of Pablo Escobar

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Frozen Planet II, Ninja Warrior UK: Race For Glory, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?, Married at First Sight UK, the BBC news special announcing the Queen's death, the King's address to the nation and ITV News reporting Princes William and Harry on walkabout

programme.title: Sky Coppers
programme.desc: The unit hunt for a group of kids trying to set fire to a shed in an allotment. An infrared drone kit is used to search for a teenager who hasn't been seen since climbing a scaffolding around a nightclub in Birmingham. Plus, the night-time search for a burglar breaking into a house with a suspected cannabis crop

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: At Queen's Medical Centre in Nottingham, one of the busiest A&E departments in Europe, 77-year-old Keith is treated for a cardiac arrest and Joanna has a spinal fracture after falling from her horse. In the Urgent Treatment Unit, 79-year-old John is being patched up after being run over by a car at his local market

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The holiday hosts meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. Feedback ranges from sleep issues and beef about breakfast bothers, to tabletop troubles and Derek's slumber sorrows. Strong opinions are aired and differences debated, before the winner is finally announced

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ballroom dancing instructor Stuart hosts the first of five parties from in and around Newcastle, hoping his colourful but healthy menu will impress Adam, Harriet, Mo and Jude

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second night of the competition from in and around Newcastle, and the turn of Adam to host. He opts for an evening of fine dining and up-market gastro pub food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nursing student Harriet hosts the third night of the competition in Newcastle, throwing a dinner party entirely themed around her equestrian hobby

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Day four in Newcastle sees videographer Jude hoping to win over her guests with a decidedly experimental vegetarian menu, which has a distinct lack of vegetables

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final night of the competition from in and around Newcastle, sees Mo act as host with a menu of traditional South African dishes. There's all to play for as the other guests all believe they are in with a chance, except for veggie Jude who has realised that her disastrous menu has put paid to any chances of her grabbing the grand

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: In Spain, cameras revisit a hotelier feeling the full force of Covid - could a new money-making plan turn around her fortune? Plus, a couple from London who sunk their savings into expanding their gte business in France and the pair of winemakers in France who took an expensive gamble to double the size of their vineyard

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Lincolnshire couple Peter and Diane Bates, who have long dreamt of enjoying a Mediterranean lifestyle in Spain, showing them traditional properties for under 35,000 in the province of Malaga

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a couple on the verge of retirement decide between homes either side of the Channel. While Tony has his eye on Shropshire, an area he feels is familiar and beautiful, Kimm is drawn to the French way of life the Dordogne offers

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Garner mother-and-son duo Sharon and Shaun help a 58-year-old woman search for a property in Almeria where she can realise her dream of rescuing horses

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Theatre enthusiast Jay Coleman hosts the first party in Newport, Gwent, putting on a dramatic evening with an international menu, in the hope of winning the 1,000 prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peace activist Pippa Bartolotti hosts the second of the week's dinner parties in Newport, Gwent, serving up a menu of locally sourced vegetarian food and hoping to entertain her guests by indulging in a spot of fortune-telling. However, a talkative Duncan Powell threatens to dominate proceedings

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Radio journalist Emma Jones hosts the third dinner party in Newport, Gwent, serving up an American-themed menu of crab cakes and pulled pork, and the 23-year-old tries to boost her chances of taking home the prize money with a cheerleading session

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housewife Sarah Kinnear hosts the fourth dinner party in Newport, Gwent, and her guests are encouraged to attend wearing 'Welsh icon' attire. However, she takes a gamble when she engages in a lively dinner-table debate with Duncan and Pippa

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment boss Duncan Powell hosts the final dinner party in Newport, Gwent, and hopes his Hawaiian-themed evening will impress his guests enough to win the prize. Unfortunately for him, prawn brains and sea bass bones harm his chances of success, so the confident cook tries to rescue the evening with a lemon posset

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Danni Menzies arrives in the beautiful coastal town of Nerja in southern Spain to meet house-hunter Frances, who is dreaming of buying a holiday home she can enjoy with her friends and family. With her daughter Karina also on hand to lend her support, Frances would love to find a two-bed property close to the sea, so Danni sets out to deliver her dream within a budget of 200,000

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Black rhino Kitani is due to give birth at Chester Zoo and help swell the ranks of this endangered species, but, having lost three previous calves, it is a worrying time and the keepers are concerned that things aren't going to plan. The zoo also has four rare new arrivals called tenrecs, mysterious mammals from Madagascar and, with so little known about them, the keepers try everything they can to help them breed, while red river hog Mali has given birth to twins, but tearaway dad Confetti is a threat to his own babies

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc: The trainers give advice to Melissa, whose labrador-cross Milo is running rings around her and makes a dash for it every time she calls his name. Two-year old zuchon Archie is aggressive to strangers and has begun to bite, and mother and daughter owners Kirsty and Katie are desperate to end hiss reign of terror before it gets any worse

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: At Queen's Medical Centre in Nottingham, one of the busiest A&E departments in Europe, 77-year-old Keith is treated for a cardiac arrest and Joanna has a spinal fracture after falling from her horse. In the Urgent Treatment Unit, 79-year-old John is being patched up after being run over by a car at his local market

programme.desc: The unit hunt for a group of kids trying to set fire to a shed in an allotment. An infrared drone kit is used to search for a teenager who hasn't been seen since climbing a scaffolding around a nightclub in Birmingham. Plus, the night-time search for a burglar breaking into a house with a suspected cannabis crop

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Memorable moments of the year, featuring some of the country's favourite celebrities critiquing TV shows that they have watched. The line-up of famous faces includes Clare Balding and Alice Arnold, Gyles Brandreth and Maureen Lipman, Lorraine Kelly and her daughter Rosie, Nick Grimshaw and his niece Liv, Mo Gilligan and Babatunde Aleshe, Tom Jones and Anne-Marie, and Shaun Ryder and Bez. Shows appraised include Masked Dancer, First Dates, Quizness, The Handmaid's Tale, Secret Crush, Extreme Sisters, Sex/Life and Celebrity Karaoke Club

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Retrospective edition recalling series highlights from 2022. The line-up of famous faces includes Rylan, Gyles Brandreth, Joanna Lumley, Tom Allen, Rob Beckett, Mo Gilligan, Babatunde Aleshe, Denise Van Outen, Duncan James, Sophie Ellis-Bextor, Zoe Ball, Shaun Ryder and Bez. They comment on shows including Love Island, Platinum Party at the Palace, The Savoy, Spooked Scotland, Saturday Night Fever, Big Boys and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire: Soccer Aid Special

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on The Great British Bake Off, Vigil, Changing Rooms, Sex Actually with Alice Levine, This Morning and Michel Roux's French Country Cooking. They also offer their opinions on the gas crisis and the relaxation of travel restrictions, as reported by the BBC and ITV

programme.title: Millionaire Hoarders
programme.desc: Experts sift through homes crammed with potential treasure to unearth prized items that could raise life-changing sums of cash. The first episode features Simon and Adity, who quit their city jobs to take on Simon's family home - a 700-year-old castle in Scotland. They've called in the experts to raise cash from the property's vast collection of antiques, manuscripts and paintings

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Director of the country office, Amy has a listing for a 7.25million house in Oxshott, Surrey. Just an hour outside of London and close to the Chelsea Football Club's training ground, she is looking for a wealthy football fan to buy the property that boasts a large garden with an outdoor jacuzzi, sauna and entertainment area. Managing director Guy visits an 18th-century chateau in the Loire Valley with its own 18-hole golf course that is available to rent for 30,000 a night. In London, Diana meets a millionaire whose private jet business is booming and is looking for a pied-a-terre to buy or rent. Developer Kam, who is restoring the former stately home Doughty House in Richmond Hill expects that, once completed, the super-mansion with 12 bedrooms, a ballroom, a pool, a spa and a bowling alley will hit the market for 100million

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: While renovating a new bridal bedroom, Julia battles cracked plaster and expensive surprises. Anna and Edward get creative with the candles left over from weddings in a bid to save money. At Chateau Gioux, Debbie and Nigel bring new life to an old piano by creating a vibrant gin bar

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Katie-Louise, who runs a buy-and-sell website for expats, is on a mission to persuade businesses to donate for a charity auction to play out live on the radio. Meanwhile, Geoff, who has become the very first Mr Whippy of Benidorm, having bought a van and fitted it out with a soft ice cream machine, faces a potentially terminal problem when his generator blows up

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Another glimpse into the lives of expats who have left the UK for a new life in the Spanish sun. Cabaret star Mark - who appears on stage as Ruby Rox - films a video to play as part of his show, and sisters Vina and Nilam launch a business selling spice kits so expats can make their own curries. Tattoo artists Blane and Mark are in need of more customers, while retiree and metal detector enthusiast Stan spends his evenings searching the beaches for small change

programme.title: Car Pound Cops: Give Me My Car Back!
programme.desc: Following the work of recovery crews as they trace, track and tow vehicles driven illegally on Britain's roads. With access to two recovery companies, the series follows the action from the moment they are called in, to the trucks arriving on scene, and eventually towing the vehicle away to be impounded

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Paul Shamplina helps landlord David Coppen evict a tenant who has been upsetting the neighbours, while letting agent Paul Ainsworth Lord confronts a volatile tenant who has been keeping terrapins in his bath, as well as chasing a guarantor for rent arrears from tenants in a flea-infested flat. In Wigan, letting agents Karen O'Connor and Gemma Painter from Lobster Lettings discover a house trashed and abandoned.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: An 80mph pursuit carries on for 15 miles across North Yorkshire, while wet roads make a 90mph chase near Scarborough even more dangerous. Another pursuit is aborted when the driver pulls over to relieve himself, and officers find an open crate of lager in his car. Jamie Theakston presents

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Twenty-five miles north of York, Julian is called to the scene of a crash in which a car careered off the road and hit a tree, with the driver pronounced dead at the scene. Elsewhere, officers disturb two suspects they believe have been carrying out break-ins leading to a 100mph chase across a golf course

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Ross and John put their armed-response training to the test when they tackle a suspected gunman, while teams are called out to deal with the results of dangerous driving after a person parks on a roundabout and a pedestrian is crushed under a car. Elsewhere, officers raid a cannabis farm, a Reliant Robin is bid a fiery farewell, and Phil finds out what happens when the driver of a Subaru Impreza decides to take on an HGV

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Duggie and Mark show that they are as quick on their feet as they are behind the wheel when a serial offender tries to give them the runaround. A high-speed pursuit comes to a painful finish, PC Dan Myerscough loses patience with a silver-tongued drunk, and officers Martin and Hayley are called out to a 4x4 that has come a cropper due to treacherous ice

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Angus and Sean resort to smashing down a door in a desperate attempt to save a man's life, and Kev and Colin spot a car being driven in the wrong direction down a motorway. Darren encounters a pizza delivery man who is under the influence of alcohol, while out on patrol, Hayley observes the damage that can be caused by Cumbria's treacherously icy roads

programme.title: Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly
programme.desc: Graeme meets a Chihuahua named Hulk that has a tendency to be vicious towards its owners, who are tired of being unable to give their pet a cuddle without fear of getting nipped. programme.title: Home and Away

programme.desc: Following the dramatic work of recovery crews as they trace, track and tow vehicles driven illegally on Britain's roads. programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Catching up with a landlord two years after he got his property back from a troublesome tenant who refused to leave the property without a fight. Lawyer Chris Sharp helps two Ghanaian ministers, Reverend Sarpong and Ibrahim Farook, get back their 18th century church in the heart of Liverpool so they can launch a ministry and community centre there

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: An elderly woman near York has collapsed in her bathroom, jamming the door shut. Near the Yorkshire Dales, an elderly man driving without his glasses is responsible for a hit and run. And in Filey, North Yorkshire, a people-carrier has collided with a mobility scooter. Jamie Theakston presents

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Police are called to a serious multiple-vehicle collision on the A64 that brings the northbound carriageway to a standstill, with the driver in the worst-affected car being airlifted to hospital with severe injuries. Near Scarborough, a VW Golf with no MOT fails to stop and clocks up speeds in excess of 100mph before colliding with a police car

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers patrol during Black Eye Friday - one of Cumbria's most alcohol-fuelled nights of the year, and help a woman trapped inside a burning car. Meanwhile, a boy racer is made to call his mother after being caught misbehaving, and a motorway pursuit is brought to an abrupt end

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers Hayley and Ben can barely believe their eyes when they encounter a drunk driver in the fast lane of the M6, and dog handler Glenn is given a crash course in marine rescue when he answers an emergency distress call. Plus, a monster-truck owner tries to give police the slip and a pizza-delivery driver gets a special order from the interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A huge haul of cash is uncovered during a routine stop, leaving Duggie speechless, and a van driver tries to ram an interceptor on the busy M6. Meanwhile, Hayley and Ben rush to a frightening accident on the motorway, dog-handler Barry catches a burglar and the air ambulance is scrambled to a crash involving a school bus on a country road

programme.title: Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly
programme.desc: Graeme Hall meets a spaniel that has been stealing items and eating them, and has had a sock and a face mask surgically removed in the past, something that has cost owners Jackie and Daisy thousands of pounds. As a result, Jackie has to resort to extreme measures and has him permanently on a lead, even inside their home. Elsewhere, Graeme meets Phil and Sarah and their dog Buddy, who is incredibly jealous and snaps at the couple when they get to close to one another

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Lyrik pulls out of Battle of the Bands under tragic circumstances. Remi breaks heartbreaking news to Tane and he anxiously waits to collect his wife while Eden consoles her

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Marilyn continues to receive threats from someone over the Stunning Organics saga. Lives are on the line for some of the Bay's residents

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Jiwanji sees a six-week-old baby whose parents have noticed a white flash in his left eye, while Dr Ranj Kochhar sends a patient struggling to breathe to the hospital for urgent testing. Nurse Indira Thakrar looks after a motorcyclist, whose recent accident left him with a broken back and neck and a wound to his arm and wrist, and orthopaedic doctor David Ward is consulted by a woman who tried to reset a broken finger

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Barnsley Hospital treats the largest number of patients in a single shift in its history, including a man being rushed in with a suspected brain injury. Health care assistant Sharon Bailey and volunteer Jane Allen try to keep their colleagues' spirits up with tea and cake, while a nine-year-old girl in the paediatric triage area does not want to stay overnight and a strange smell emerges from the lost property box

programme.title: A&E After Dark
programme.desc: The night staff at Hull Royal Infirmary battle to save the sight of 51-year-old Patricia, who tripped and impaled her eye on a tent peg. With her vision impaired, a CT scan reveals a bleed on the brain that requires the intervention of neurosurgeon Dr Kenneth. Plus, a patient is flown in by air ambulance after falling down a ditch in her mobility scooter

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: When Duncan is admitted to Royal Stoke emergency department after falling down a full flight of stairs onto concrete, trauma team leader Richard Hall fears the worst. Elsewhere, a woman with a life-threatening brain tumour undergoes surgery to have it carefully removed, and a 21-year-old is treated after falling from a window and landing on metal railings

programme.title: Ambulance: Code Red

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Andy collars a suspect thought to have caused criminal damage at a house party, but the father of the host arrives and inflames the situation, while Duggie and Mark respond to a report of a car that has been abandoned after being involved in a crash near Carlisle. Maisie the Maltipoo should be the perfect mascot for aspiring fashionista Charlotte, but she's turning heads for all the wrong reasons. programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series focuses on Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Another edition of the fly-on-the-wall documentary accessing the world of national security at Australia's biggest airports, following customs and immigration officers as they go about their daily business of tackling drug runners, illegal immigrants and terrorists

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary accessing the world of national security at Australia's biggest airports as customs and immigration officers tackle drug runners, illegal immigrants and terrorists

programme.title: Warehouse 13
programme.desc: Rebecca, a Warehouse agent employed in the 1960s, returns and asks Pete and Myka to go back in time and close a case that she and her partner Jack were never able to solve - an artefact capable of turning people into glass, used by a man to kill three of his secretaries and his wife

programme.title: Quantum Leap
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sam realises why he was sent to 1956, and tries to find a way to get home - only to discover his situation is more complex than either he or Al had realised. Starring Scott Bakula, Dean Stockwell and guest starring Jennifer Runyon

programme.title: Merlin
programme.desc: Worried that the knights will let him win because of who he is, Arthur enters Camelot's jousting competition anonymously. Though he struggles to adapt to living undercover at Gwen's house without the privileges of rank, the prince is so determined to prove he can do it that he fails to spot the danger from a bounty hunter sent to kill him. Fantasy drama, guest starring Adrian Lester, with Bradley James and Angel Coulby

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: Seven of Nine and Tuvok embark on an away mission to study a micro nebula, but are captured by an alien named Park. The former Borg finds herself forced to fight for her colleague's life in a gladiatorial arena, as part of a 'Tsunkatse' competition. Sci-fi drama, guest starring Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a US Navy sailor is found dead, the team tracks the suspicious movements of people in his life prior to his death

programme.title: Forensics: Catching the Killer
programme.desc: The fragments of evidence that helped piece together what happened to 15-year-old Karen Price, who disappeared in 1981 only for her body to be found eight years later

programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: Nick, Hank and Wu investigate a bizarre murder in a local park, Capt Renard deals with a ghost from his past, and Monroe and Rosalee try to find out if Diana' premonition is true

programme.title: Snapped
programme.desc: The international manhunt that followed the murder of a young dentist, revealing a trail of surveillance evidence and a deep conspiracy of lies

programme.title: Killer in My Village
programme.desc: An obsessive gambler murders his wealthy friend before adopting his identity to fund his extravagant lifestyle

programme.title: The Force: North East
programme.desc: Police hunt for a man wanted for domestic violence, while a tip-off leads to a drugs raid and an uninsured driver gives officers the runaround

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: An immigration officer clashes with her boss, and customs staff target travellers trying to smuggle illicit goods

programme.title: Highway Patrol
programme.desc: Following Australia's traffic enforcers as they deal with high-speed chases, defiant hooligans and explosive crashes

programme.title: Highway Patrol
programme.desc: Following Australia's traffic enforcers as they deal with high-speed chases, defiant hooligans and explosive crashes

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: Talk to Al Jazeera
programme.desc: One-on-one conversations with global leaders, icons, influencers and alternative voices shaping our times.

programme.title: UBOS
programme.desc: Verne arrives at a magical new school, where he befriends two junior spell-casters and discovers an underworld controlled by an evil wizard

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Skysurfer Strike Force
programme.desc: Jack Holister is an extraordinary skydiver who leads a group of vigilante crime fighters known as the Skysurfer Strike Force. who must try to seek out and defeat the robotic Cybron

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance.

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: Hitler's Bodyguard
programme.desc: How the Stauffenberg bomb missed Hitler by inches. Documentary investigating how the German leader managed to escape assassination several times thanks to his handpicked bodyguards

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton crosses the Sea of the Hebrides to explore the Shiants, once owned by Compton Mackenzie, the author of Whisky Galore. He then heads east to the romantic Isle of Ewe, before taking a kayak trip to the Summer Isles, where he samples a seaweed feast, and on to the cliffs of Handa

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton visits Islay, travelling from Finlaggan - where the famous ruler Somerled once held court - along the windswept coast, through its historic ports and villages to end on its highest mountain. Along the way he joins dedicated locals keeping the seafaring traditions of the island alive, discovers the secrets of Islay's illicit whisky distilling past and climbs Ben Vicar for a breathtaking view across the Hebrides

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: Sheltering from a blizzard in a cave, Monkey tries to trick Pigsy into sacrificing himself to save Tripitaka's life. Cult adventure, starring Masoaki Sakai and Toshiyuki Nishida

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: A new planet is sighted, and after holding a seance one of the Moonbase crew becomes convinced it is habitable and tries to force Commander Koenig to evacuate all Alphans to live there. Sci-fi adventure, with Martin Landau

programme.title: Sabotage (1936)
programme.desc: An undercover detective poses as a grocer to get closer to a suspected terrorist thought to be plotting to blow up London. Alfred Hitchcock's thriller based on Joseph Conrad's The Secret Agent, starring Oscar Homolka, Sylvia Sidney, John Loder, Desmond Tester and Joyce Barbour

programme.title: The Trap (1966)
programme.desc: A woman is sold to a trapper in 19th-century British Columbia and reluctantly becomes his wife, overcoming her initial fears to nurse him through an illness. Drama, starring Oliver Reed, Rita Tushingham and Rex Sevenoaks

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Steed heads north to investigate a mysterious laird, who he believes is responsible for fish disappearing from the Scottish coast - and maybe the dead diver found stretched on a rack. Patrick Macnee stars

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: The exuberant chef gives brunch a new twist, serving up an extra-special BLT sandwich, hot Bloody Mary soup, mushrooms stuffed with soft garlic cheese, pesto-rippled scrambled eggs and ricotta pancakes with mulled strawberries. He also gets the chance to sample the unusual and creative all-day brunch at Denial in Birmingham, which includes sausages with pan-fried grapes

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Italy Made With Love
programme.desc: Umbria, the green heart of Italy, is the land that time and tourism forgot. Shaped by geography and politics, the region became a thriving model of creative self-sufficiency

programme.title: An Englishman in New York
programme.desc: John Hurt reprises his role as Quentin Crisp in this sequel to The Naked Civil Servant, picking up his story where the 1975 drama about the eccentric Englishman left off. Crisp sets off on the journey of a lifetime to the Big Apple, where the Americans immediately embrace the openly gay writer and his waspish ways, and before long he is being wined and dined by celebrities in every corner of Manhattan. But, as is so often the case with Quentin, he cannot resist making outrageous comments, and an ill-considered quip about the growing Aids crisis sees him suddenly dropped from high society. Sex and the City's Cynthia Nixon co-stars as performance artist Penny Arcade, with Jonathan Tucker, Denis O'Hare and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: The Informers (1963)
programme.desc: The murder of a Scotland Yard informer starts a trail of deceit and intrigue among London's underworld, prompting a police inspector to conduct his own unorthodox investigation. Thriller, starring Nigel Patrick, Margaret Whiting, Colin Blakely and Derren Nesbitt

programme.title: Everything Must Go (2010)
programme.desc: A man's heavy drinking costs him his job and leads to his wife kicking him out of the house. He sets up home on their lawn, amid all the possessions she has thrown out, and to avoid seeming homeless, he begins selling them, leading him to make new friendships with his neighbours and gradually straighten out his life. Comedy drama, starring Will Ferrell and Laura Dern

programme.title: Blackonomics
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the UK's Afro-Caribbean community's relationship with money when it comes to education, investing and building general wealth

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay.

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: UBOS
programme.desc: The trio search for an antidote to thwart Zarlak's plans to infect the enchanted winged creatures

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: An RAF clerk returns from the war to find his house in ruins - destroyed not by German bombs, but by his wife forgetting to turn off the gas

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: Harvey finds reacquainting himself with his estranged son is not as easy as he initially thought

programme.title: The Lion Queen
programme.desc: New arrivals put added pressure on limited resources as two rescued lions arrive at Glen Garriff. A male, called TJ, is unwell and requires the vet, while a cub is mauled by one of the lions

programme.title: Italy Made With Love
programme.desc: Umbria, the green heart of Italy, is the land that time and tourism forgot. Shaped by geography and politics, the region became a thriving model of creative self-sufficiency

programme.title: Clive James
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Clive and his cardboard suitcase arrived in London. Decades later, he reassesses the city he knew then and explores the city he finds now.

programme.title: The Cup (2011)
programme.desc: Australian jockey Damien Oliver prepares to follow in his father's footsteps and compete in the 2002 Melbourne Cup. However, the weeks leading up to the event are rocked by tragedy for both Oliver himself, who faces a death in the family, and for the nation in the wake of the Bali bombings. Fact-based drama, starring Stephen Curry and Brendan Gleeson

programme.title: The Waterbabies (1978)
programme.desc: A runaway chimney sweep flees from his wicked master and stumbles across a strange underwater kingdom. As he tries to return to his own world, he discovers he must first save a group of water babies from a deadly foe. Children's adventure based on the novel by Charles Kingsley, starring James Mason, Billie Whitelaw and Tommy Pender

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: The exuberant chef gives brunch a new twist, serving up an extra-special BLT sandwich, hot Bloody Mary soup, mushrooms stuffed with soft garlic cheese, pesto-rippled scrambled eggs and ricotta pancakes with mulled strawberries.
